description:
The food is good. I came here during my lunch break from UCSF. I ordered the Wonton in chilli sauce and Mongolian beef chow mein. Both were excellent.

I wanted to substitute the thick noodles to the thinner noodles on my Mongolian beef chow mein. They wanted an extra charge of $3.00, which I pay bc I like the thinner egg noodles. The really shouldn't nickel and dime people.

Noodle are noodles. I buy noodle from the Chinese market often. Noodles are very inexpensive!
author: James N.

description:
Ordered delivery at 3:30 PM on a Monday (fulfilled via GrubHub) -- estimated time to deliver 60-70 mins.  Called at 5PM (90 mins post order), was told they were "very busy" and sometimes it takes much longer than 70 minutes to deliver.  Actual delivery time 5:15 (105 mins).  

Recommend updating that language then to reflect actual delivery times might be....infinity?  Just following her logic.

Food was meh.  Ordered everything light on the sauce, think they interpreted that as "extra, excessive, way more sauce than anyone would ever need".  Won't be ordering again.
author: Tyler K.

description:
The last 4-5 times I've ordered from Chang's (either via Yelp or called it in and picked it up), they struggle with including hot sauce/chili oil. Last month, I called in an order for 4 entrees and picked it up on my way home. I asked the lady (the older lady who's always working) to include some hot sauce and chili oil in the bag. When she brings it to me, there is not hot sauce. I ask her AGAIN, and she brings one. I said, "excuse me, I ordered 4 entrees - can I at least have 4?". She huffed and puffed and threw 3 more my way. 

Tonight, I ordered my food delivery via Yelp. I put specific instructions 3 times saying "please include hot sauce/chili oil with each entree". I received my order, and alas, no hot sauce. 

Hot sauce & chili oil costs nothing -- this is just a representation of poor customer service.
author: Zoe Y.

description: Late post: Again non of the food was good except the dry fried chicken wings and string beans but the service was nice. Not much to say beside I love their chicken wings which they do deliver for parties. Oh ....do not get the fried salt n pepper calamari. It was so salty.
author: Christy V.

description:
Chang's Kitchen never disappoints. My family has been coming here for over 6 years. Mr. Lu and Jenny have seen my children grow up from babies to school aged kids. My family love coming to this place. 

We ordered the Hong Kong combination noodles (Hong Kong Style is crispy noodles), string beans with beef and salt and pepper fish. My kids absolutely LOVE the HK combination noodles it comes with a variety of vegetables and meats to include seafood. That dish is always the one that gets emptied first. 

Mr. Lu and Jenny are always personable and treat us like family. 

Great food and personable staff = Great place to eat!!! Enjoy!!!!
author: Dorothy B.

description:
Apparently, this restaurant has changed hands many times over the last few years. They currently have four chefs in the kitchen, so the food is cooked fairly quickly. I like that they have dishes from many different provinces in China like Shanghai, Guangdong, Szechuan, etc - a diverse menu. 

To start off the meal, there is complementary soup. I ended up ordering their homemade green onion pancakes, which were a bit dry. The fried egg roll with taro was very crispy and delicious, and so was the fish fillet in chili oil and Shanghainese pan fried noodle. 

The service is also very good. All the servers, especially the older guy, were so friendly and had such good energy. It was nice talking to them and hearing what they had to say about the restaurant and their dishes.
author: Kristine P.

description:
EVENT: one of those days you seriously don't want to cook - which is everyday for me... lol... I moved to a different location in SF and currently tryna find a new "go to Chinese comfort food place." I walked pass this place a couple times and never though of going in... but... here I am... I'm finally trying this place.

FOOD: I ordered togo
(1) Wonton Soup: wontons well made! Carrots and cabbage! delish - 4 stars 
(2) Salt & Pepper chicken wings: OMG SO GOOD! If you like salt & pepper shrimp.. you'll like this Salt & Pepper Chicken. It's battered well, super crispy, and savory! Def... will order this again! 5 stars! **MUST TRY**

**OVERALL: I'll come back for the salt & pepper chicken! 4 stars overall! YUMS!
author: Mindy Y.

description: Ordered sesame chicken and each chunk had 70% dough. Go see the photo. We also got the same amount of meat as we do at Panda Express but Panda Express bowls come with a side and rice or noodles, at a cheaper price too.. Panda Express food taste better than this place's food. The only good thing I could say about this place is the elderly man who waited our table was very kind and checked in on us a few times. Either way, we will never come back, can't trust these cooks. They just lost a customer group of 3 for playing around with our food
author: YH L.

description: Great place good atmosphere reasonable prices everyone here is nice. Must try the dry fried chicken it will not disappoint
author: Vinnie M.

description: Came here the other night after giving up an hour long wait for San Tung. Food was decent and the service was good. Server was kind and attentive. Beware that they include tip in your bill! My order was only supposed to be around $5 and i ended up paying almost $10.
author: Gabby O.

description: Not a fan. All items were greasy. The twice cooked pork was mostly not edible. General Tso was overly breaded with too much sauce. The salt and pepper chicken wings had promise but all the wings had something odd going on with the way they were butchered. The chow fun and fried rice were coates in oil making it not worth finishing.
author: Ken R.

description: We were supposed to go to the Chinese food place across the street but they were closed, and I'm so glad they were! Chang's kitchen hit right on the spot. The staff was soooo friendly and welcoming that's what I loved most about here. And the food was DELICIOUS. I told my friend I'm going to be coming here every week! Haha. Their prices aren't bad either, I just had an amazing experience.
author: Diana P.

description: I am NOT surprised as to why/how this place has close to five stars. The best part about this restaurant is the owner. He has such an amazing sense of humor! It's entertaining. The service is amazing and fast. You have to order their Mongolian beef. I always order Mongolian beef with rice every time I eat out at a Chinese restaurant and no one has disappointed me yet. Chang's Kitchen's Mongolian beef is by far one of the best I've ever tried. I'm a very picky eater and very critical when it comes to my food so that should say a lot haha. My boyfriend ordered their orange chicken. That was the first time that he and I have tried orange chicken, spicy! It was different because it was a new taste for us but it was good. Not as good as the Mongolian beef though.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Over priced, below average Chinese food! The sesame chicken should be renamed sesame dough with a little chicken because there's more dough than chicken and it wasn't even crunchy! The person who takes the order over the phone was rude and when we got there the food wasn't even ready to be picked up!
author: Mike W.

description:
Best deal at Lunch in Sunset
Tasty Canton dishes also Chinese dishes 
The fish filet with sweet corn is the best ! 
Nomnomnom
author: amy y.

description: When we walked in on a Wednesday during lunch, we were greeted by friendly staff and were seated right away. We got the mabo tofu and the Shanghai dumplings (10 count). Oh my gosh, that was a lot of food. I would say the size of the meal could feed 3 people. Especially the mabo tofu had very generous  portions. At the end of the meal, the kind staff even PACKED our lunch for us! I did not expect that, for even some higher end restaurants do not do that! The food was delicious and we had an amazing experience.
author: Julia S.

description: The was 18 years old the last time I ate at this restaurant and I'm now 33! This is my absolute favorite Chinese food in SF! The food is great and the owner is so nice and friendly. He has really great customer service!!! Definitely would recommend the Beijing chicken, walnuts shrimp, and salt and pepper prawns!!!!
author: Hanalei M.

description:
This place keeps me fed. They have such a large menu, (including vegetarian meats and dim sum) it would hard to find something you didn't want to eat! 
I stumbled upon Changs when I was waiting for my table at San Tung and months later have still never made it to ST because Changs has quick service and delicious meals! Changs always meets my expectations for a great meal.
I've liked everything I'd ordered and always try something new because of that. In house or delivery... I'm in. Thanks to the Changs Kitchen staff!
author: Stephanie D.

description: This place is across the street from Shantung or 山東小館 that is always packed and this place always has a table.  I don't get it. ST is alright. Nothing special. The food is about the same as this place. The prices a slight better here. And the staff & friendly and remembered me the 2nd time I came. The people are from Guangzhou so speak to them in Cantonese is you can. They will be so grateful & you will get better food.
author: Leung T.

description: Chang's Kitchen is my go to for good Chinese food. Service is excellent, food is tasty, accessible location, and friendly staff especially Lou. Lou knows our favorites to the point that he starts uttering them before we sit down and all we have to say is "Yep!" :)
author: Cecille A.

description:
I would've given this place 5 stars for the prior 4 times weve came here. But the last time my dad and I came here, the service and food were good as usual. 

What pissed me off was that we paid our bill, and left a cash tip.

We started to head out the door and couldn't have been more than 3 or 4 steps out the door. When one if the servers yelled at me and my father! She said "hey! Where's my tip?!!" Are you freaking kidding me?!?!? I said excuse me ??? Your tip is  on the table! Look a little harder for that $6... the bill was only $29 or so... what I should've done was go back inside and snatched the tip off the table. 

Rude ass bitch didnt deserve a tip after coming at us like that! They've just lost out business. Which sucks because the food is usually really good, and the older gentleman who has served us before is really kind and  down to earth. Smh!.... the nerve of that server. So just beware if you eat here. They might chase after you when their blind ass servers can't see cash.
author: Coraline J.

description: Today I was going to stop and eat here but first I needed to use the bathroom and the waiter charged me $3.50 for a soda to use their bathroom. After that I didn't even bother to sit and eat here. I was astonished at the service. He didn't even ask to see if I was going to eat here. I ended up going across the street to eat.
author: Angela L.

description:
This is place is very right one for me! I like dry fried chicken wings, here is very delicious, better than other restaurants, crispy, soft inside, yummy! 
Service is always my favorite, Jenny and Lu very humble, very nice, 5 Star.
author: Yabin L.

description: Chang's Kitchen has pretty authentic Chinese-American food. The old man who took my order was a dear and he always made sure my water cup was full so service was awesome! If you're going to eat here, the one thing that id like to HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend would be the barbecue pork buns. i rarely eat buns so i got it to just try something new but it was AMAZING. there isn't a lot of filling but the buns are sweet and served hot so the next time i come, i think i'll only order this honestly. The tai chow fun was lacking in flavor though and the chunks of broccoli were way too big. i also got the fried rice and it was decent but nothing matches the bbq pork buns!
author: Maya S.

description:
I think the only reason why my boyfriend and I came here was because San Tung was super busy. And it got great ratings on Yelp, but I was disappointed with the food. We tried the minced beef cilantro egg white fried rice, chicken wings with fries (just for kicks), and the green onion pancake. The fried rice was really flat and didn't really have any flavor. And the chicken wings and fries were decent. But the green onion pancake was way too thick and needed some dipping sauce.

I will say the service was outstanding. Probably the best service I've had at a Chinese restaurant. Our waiter was really intuitive and knew when we needed napkins, more tea, etc., all without us asking for them. But he knew we would need them :)
author: Rachel H.

description:
After a crazy line at San Tung and the line not moving this was the best option for a party of 15+. They were able to accommodate the number of people and service was good. Most of the people got the canton special. Some of the highlight dishes were the honey walnut prawns and the wings were a ok substitute. Most dishes were just aright and nothing too special. 

A decent alternative to San Tung if you're hungry and tired of waiting.
author: James H.

description: Ordered the beef, very chewy, noodles was very plain, I asked the waitress, she insisted the quality is good and refused to take it back, and insisted to charge half of the price. Don't know where the good reviews come from, definitely will never come back. Horrible food quality and service
author: Amy A.

description:
Decent take out and the free delivery is amazing. Ordered through Yelp. I got the dim sum platter, shrimp wanton, and spring rolls. The dim sum platter was pretty good. Shrimp wanton was not shrimp wanton, so that was sad. It was like pork wanton with shrimp pieces around.

I would order again, especially with free delivery.
author: Tina L.

description:
This little hole in the wall has some really good food.  We were promptly seated and then we were served hot tea on the house.  We then waited for our order to be taken, but after about 15 minutes we gave up.  W hunted someone down to take our order.

W ordered the crispy duck lunch special, which included an egg roll, hot and sour soup and rice.  I ordered veggie mu shu from the regular menu.  We shared an order of shrimp and chive dumplings.  Everything was so delicious and fresh.  We both loved our food and the servers.

Our server was very nice, but I had to ask for water twice and our orders were delivered separately.  I had to wait a bit longer to receive my dish.  Also, the dumplings were delivered when we were about half way through with our meals.

I definitely give the food 5 stars.  It did seem that every other table was received better service than us.  Maybe it was because we were seated at a table facing a window away from the servers.  Anyway, it definitely would not stop us from returning.
author: Teresa L.

description: So I ordered food once and it was great. The second time I ordered with friends and  I literally bit into a piece of metal that was in my food!!! We placed a big order because I recommend this place to my friends. But to my embarrassment, I found a screw in my food, screw me! A piece of f'n metal! This place is lucky the inspector hasn't been called yet. We talked to a manager to complain but they wanted to comp one item only. We expressed that we didn't feel safe eating the rest of the food but they didn't care. They were only going to refund us for one item. Wow! That was a poor business decision on them. I could have been really hurt by them and had to throw away all that food!
author: Jose J.

description:
Came in for the fried chicken, which were somewhat disappointing. There was a symbol on the menu indicating that the wings would be a bit spicy, but they ended up being pretty sweet. They were also just thick in sauce, which took away from the fried chicken.

The salt and pepper pork and salt and pepper calamari were tasty. The pork was delicious and perfectly cooked. The calamari was alright, but a little small in portion.

(Date of visit: 07/23/2017)
author: Adrian M.

description: If you don't have time to wait for San Tung this restaurant is a very much adequate alternative. Although their dry fried chicken isn't on par with San Tung, maybe 80%, but the selection and taste of the other plates are pretty good. Although there's usually a long line at San Tung, this restaurant will usually have a table. Definitely worth a visit. Let me know your thoughts if you're going from this review!
author: Murray N.

description:
Dry fried chicken wings were fried nicely but I thought the sauce was cloyingly sweet and not good at all. Not what I expect from Chinese chicken wings. As someone who pretty much loves eating any chicken wing, I couldn't eat more than two of these because the sauce was weird.

Salt and pepper pork chops are delicious! Nice, hefty portion and seasoned perfectly. Fried to perfection and not dried out.

Salt and pepper calamari was okay! Rather small portion. Fried nicely and seasoned well.

Siu mai was standard/nothing special other than being a bit meatier than siu mai I've had in OC - but definitely overpriced at being around $5 for 4 pieces.

They didn't refill our waters. Tea was good but was not piping hot like how tea should be served.

Date of visit: Sunday, July 23rd, 2017
author: Brittney L.

description:
I first came here with my mom two weeks ago when we came to SF. I tried the dried fried chicken wings (mild because I can't to spicy ) and it was one of the best fried chicken I've ever had. 

I drove back from LA today and leaving SF tomorrow and stopped by here to get the same fried chicken and it was still delicious! Hot and crispy as it can get!! If I ever have the chance to come back to SF I'd definitely visit here again. Oh and I don't know the name but the old gentleman was one of the nicest person as well. Make sure to stop by this place if you're in SF
author: Minho L.

description: Their water boiled fish and ribs are fantastic. I come here very often. The servers are very friendly and prices are unimaginably reasonable. Their chicken  wings are delicious as hell. I think their food is suitable not only for Asian but also worth American native to try. Higher recommend bean ribs, chili ribs, beef brew pot. And wangtoo soup is so tasty.
author: Richen Z.

description:
My roomie and I have a weekly tradition. On Saturdays, we get huge 56oz bottles of low-quality Korean beer, play the terrible Dreamcast game Shenmue, and, most importantly, order the medium-spicy Szechuan feast from Chang's Kitchen. The delivery is super fast -- the one hour estimate always ends up being around 20 minutes. We get a meal and a half each out of it, which isn't half bad for $16 a head.

The wontons are simply sublime. They're deliciously spicy, are filled with meat that's a little sweet in addition to hot and savory, and the chili oil they come in goes great with the rest of the meal. The (free!) crab rangoons are good too, always nice and warm. I'd like them to have a little more filling in them, but what is there is tasty.

The kung pao is fine. That's all I can say about it. The Mongolian beef is good though, but Mongolian beef is always good so no surprises there. I wanna try one of the spicier ones, but my roomie can't take spice so I'll forever be left wondering if my hypothesis of "more spicy = more good" holds water.
author: Shawn W.

description:
I ordered from grubhub delivery.  The delivery was within an hour and the deliverer courteous.  I thought their lunch house special wouldn't be too filling (asian restaurants usually load a lot of white rice but a smaller portion of actual veggies/meat),  so I also got the bbq spareribs appetizers.  Well, they DO give you a lot of rice, but they give you enough house special veggies/meat which were tasty and tender.  The only neg is they should cut their broccoli and celery into smaller bite-sized pieces.  As an example, the broccoli looked like little tough trees the size of a wristwatch.

Some of the bbq spareribs were pretty tough to bite into, not at all tender and the bottom half of the spareribs carton was just all lettuce(actually not that bad since I ate it as a side salad), so that's why it's 4 stars for me.

But the house special was very tasty and filling with decent sized shrimp and good beef/chicken portions and very tasty sauce and the prices were great, so I'd DEFINITELY order here again for delivery when near their area.
author: Frugal C.

description: Came here for take out. I ordered dry fried chicken wings, honey walnut prawns, tomato beef chow mien and mushroom with egg tofu. Overall it's been a disappointment. If you read my other reviews you'll know that I recently been to San Tung, which is literally across the street. Chang's chicken wings or prawns is no comparison to San Tung's. The other restaurant has better flavor and the glaze is much better. Since they are so similar and the food I ordered are almost the same, I appreciate that both offer affordable prices for good portion. However, Chang lacks the flavor that I'm looking for. Their mushroom and egg tofu had only a few pieces of tofu and mushroom but lots of broccoli. And steer away from their tomato beef chow mien - terrible flavor and lots of raw onions. I won't come back.
author: Laura S.

description: My husband and I love Chang's! It's our go to neighborhood spot. Great front of house customer service. My husband choose this restaurant for his birthday dinner! We always order Orange chicken, sweet n sour pork, white rice, spring rolls. YUM! Their orange chicken is to die for!
author: Jes C.

description:
This place is by far our favorite Chinese food restaurant to go to in San Francisco. Not just for the food, but for the excellent service as well and I'll get to that later in the review.

Food : everything that I have tried tasted really good. From the Mongolian Beef to the Honey Walnut shrimp. AWESOME! 

Atmosphere : pretty typical of any other good chinese restaurant. Nice and welcoming environment. 
GOOD

Service : the service is good here but 1 individual goes far and beyond what you'd expect from even the best of them. His name is Lou, he's extremely accommodating, friendly, funny, and just all around great person. He takes so much pride in what he does and it really shows. When we went there last it was a day after my son's birthday. When Lou found out his bday just past he went in the back and came back with a teddy bear for my son and wished him a happy birthday. AWESOME!!!
author: Raymond M.

description:
While driving through SF, I spotted a nice little Chinese restaurant. I ordered chicken wings, green beans, walnut shrimp and salt fish fried rice. 

The chicken wings were great! 

The skin was made crunchy and the meat juicy. The sauce is sweet and spicy. 

The walnut shrimp was great!

Coconut shrimp is a perfect combination. 

The fried rice was great!!!

This was the best part of the meal. The rice had hints of ginger but not overpowering. The staff is also so friendly.I would recommend this place to anyone!
author: Travis M.

description: You guys, I was so disappointed by this place. After bottomless mimosas for brunch, I had a craving for Chinese food. I was so excited to get hui guo rou (twice cooked pork). Unfortuantely, it was ridiculously fatty and tasteless. It was probably the worst hui guo rou I've ever had in my life, and that is one of my favorite dishes. The scallion pancakes were way too thick and over-fried. The beef chow fun was the only thing that was remotely okay. Sad face :(
author: Eva W.

description:
TL;DR: Decent Chinese food! Doesn't particularly stand out compared to other restaurants on Irving but it really is decent. Reasonably cheap for SF! Free delivery is a huge plus- came quickly and food was warm!

I think Chang's deserves a little more credit! I've been here to dine in and always thought it was okay, and tonight I ordered free delivery. 

Food arrived in 30 minutes, though it had quoted me 45 min-1 hour. One large soup and one noodle dish for 2 people with free delivery, tip, and taxes cost $20.53 total, which is really cheap for SF!

Tonight I ordered sizzling rice soup and it was GOOOD. No one really mentioned it in their reviews, but I thought it tasted just as good as I used to have eating with my Chinese grandparents in SoCal. For delivery, it came with the soup and all the ingredients with the sizzling rice on the side, dry for you to add yourself. And the soup was really warm when it arrived! Warm enough that the rice still sizzled when I put it in the soup. I was impressed. I got the large size and only ate half and felt satisfied. The veggies were plentiful and tasty and the broth felt warm and comforting on a cold, sick day. It was definitely worth the $8.75 for soup that will last me 2 days (though I have a pretty small appetite)!

I would definitely order it again. :) Thanks Chang's!
author: Rebecca T.

description: The food is very good.    The fried chicken wings were better than their competitor across the street.   I am coming back soon.
author: M. W.

description: Pretty standard Chinese delivery, even a little subpar. For the price, it was fine, and the delivery was pretty snappy. Would try somewhere different next time, but it's edible and would satisfy a Chinese craving.
author: Joshua D.

description: First time here & Food was delicious!  Servers were on point and made sure we didn't need anything. Great Service!! Thank you!
author: Yubicela M.

description: Really good dry fried Chicken wings on par with San Tung - without the wait. And they deliver. Yay.
author: teray g.

description: I love the food there. My family and I go there for all special occasions. Reasonably priced for quality food and great service. They are always so sweet to my kids, too.
author: Nancy M.

description:
Large portions with top notch service. I came in for lunch with my 18mo son. I had the house special. Tea, soup, large plate of meat/veggies/rice, and an egg roll for under $9. I would have preferred a smaller portion of rice and veggies, maybe skip the soup, in exchange for a little extra meat. I only found 2 small shrimp in the whole plate. 

The staff were kind and engaged occasionally with the little one, which kept him happy to let me finish my meal. 

If you're standing in the long line across the street like I was, consider coming here for some immediate seating better prices, and comparable food.
author: Isaac O.

description:
I ordered delivery. 
It took about 30 minutes to have my food delivered which flew by pretty quickly! 
I ordered online so it was a breeze there were plenty of photos and detailed description of what you're going to order. I hardly had any customer interaction with this place aside from the delivery man whom delivered to our hotel room at Hotel Kabuki in little Tokyo. He was nice smiled & friendly. 

This was choice for my birthday dinner! Food was delicious!!! I would definitely like to dine in one day. Everything was nice and hot by the time it was delivered. They did include forks and napkins but LEFT OUT the plates which was a bummer. But did not ruin my appetite.
author: Senay B.

description:
3.5 rounded up!

I've always wanted to try this place but since there are so many other yummy options nearby, I never gave myself that opportunity. Until today, when my favorite pho place in the city closed for vacation. ):

A tad disappointed with the food as most of them were really oily and not a lot of flavor in them. I tried their dry chicken wings, I assume in an attempt to mimic the rich tangy flavors of San Tung, and it was underwhelming. Not much of a competition. I also tried their jai jerng mein and flavors did not taste like the traditional ones I've had elsewhere. 

It's not bad though, I mean I would come back if both San Tung and Yummy Yummy were closed and I already made the trip.
author: Natalie Y.

description:
The service here was pretty darn good which is why I'm gonna bump it from a 3.5 to a 4.  I like how the owner said after my meal "back to the salt mines eh...." haha. 

I had the house special for lunch which was simply beef, chicken and shrimp with rice.

Simple yet solid for $8.75.
author: Rod M.

description:
Seems like Chang's Kitchen is the place to be whenever San Tung's across the street is closed. That was the case for us but after dining in, I'm sure I'll be back specifically for Chang's food and not just San Tung's! 

The restaurant itself is really quite clean, and the staff there are pretty welcoming - not your typical "I-don't-give-a-toot" attitude you'd find at Chinese restaurants. 

FOODDDDS:
-Spicy Dry Fried Chicken Wings: These were delicious. Crispy. Juicy. Full of flavor. However, I was disappointed that our plate of wings was not spicy at all. In fact, it was more on the sweet side. The flavor is good, just not what I was looking for. 
-Spicy String Beans: YUMMMM I have to say that this was one of the better tasting string beans I've had. SO FULL of flavor - garlicky spicy saucy goodness. I actually dipped my wings in this sauce because of how much I liked it.
-Shanghai Steamed Dumplings: Average buns of soupy goodness. I wouldn't necessarily crave these or come back specifically for these, but they're good.
-Shrimp & Chive Dumplings: I think I might be biased because I have a special place in my heart for dumplings. My boyfriend didn't really care for these but I thought they were absolutely delicious in a comforting way. The dumpling skins were boiled to perfection, still had that chew to it. The filling was full of flavor - large pieces of shrimp and the chives didn't overpower the taste of the dumpling as a whole. I could probably eat like 2 orders of these by itself. 

All that food only came out to less than $40. I might not necessarily come back for the wings but I would definitely come back for their DUMPLANGSSSSSSS.
author: Ava F.

description: The food that made it into our mouths was hard to swallow and that just got worse when We found a screw in the food. A Metal SCREW! I called the restaurant to let them know. I was transferred to the owner who promptly scolded me for not telling the driver about the contaminant when he dropped off the food. How I was supposed to know that he was handing me food with hardware in it is beyond me. After multiple calls back and forth to eat24 and Changs kitchen, the manager promised me a full refund, but then told eat24 that she was only refunding the dish with the life-threatening ingredient. It is truly maddening and passive aggressive, but that is the way they chose to address this serious problem. Of course we won't be eating any of the food that came with this order, but I am out 130 bucks for the pleasure. Their food is not worth dental damage, choking, or any other serious threat to your health. The people who run this place made it very clear that your money is much more important to them than your satisfaction or your safety.  Pass on this one folks.
author: joel P.

description:
This is our favorite Chinese Restaurant in the city. The food is good but the highlight of this place is their server, Lou.
Each time we go here, he always have this very cheerful, warm, and friendly attitude. He always greets everyone with a smile and makes sure everyone is taken cared of. He is great with kids too! Whenever we are around the area, my son doesn't want to eat anywhere else. He would go  "I want to eat at Lou's restaurant!"
Yesterday was my son's birthday, I don't know how the conversation with Lou went but I ended up mentioning that it was my son's bday. Before our meal ended, he came with a little stuffed bear to give it to my son, my son came up to him and gave him a hug. 
That sweet gesture is something that we did not expect. It made an impact on my son and made him really happy, now he wants to bring Mr. Bears anywhere we go (that's what he named the toy). It made his day 

In any restaurant, the quality of food is always important, but the service matters as much. This place doesn't just offer good food, they also offer an outstanding service that you can rarely find nowadays.
author: Krizzy M.

description: Tried the Shanghai steamed dumplings and the fried chicken and both were mediocre. Fried chicken was too greasy for my liking and the steamed dumplings weren't as soft as I'm used to, as the dough was a little more chewy and not as silky.
author: Lillian B.

description:
came here last weekend because We wanted Szechuan Style food and it was really GOOD. we ordered Spicy Fish Fillet with Flaming Chili Oil with steam rice, Fish in pickled mustard green noodle soup and shrimp fried rice for our son. Both of the Szechuan dishes had good spicy and flavor. 
Can't wait to go back and try other Szechuan dishes!!!
author: Jason G.

description:
First time for me personally, dining here. We didn't plan on coming here, but the spot we went to initially had a long wait, so we decided to try this place out. Glad we did! Being from SF, we have been seeing less and less good places to grab chinese/Asian food. All the local spots are slowly changing the quality of their food and it's leaving us with barely anywhere to go. 

We only ordered a few dishes to try and they were all pretty tasty. 
- The pan fried noodles are a good portion. We got it with beef and Chinese broccoli. 
- The salt and pepper halibut is good. Also good portion. 
- The Mongolian triple meat is good. It's got a good tasty spice to it, not just heat. Next time we are gonna ask for that over the pan fried noodles. Lol! 
 - the Singapore rice noodles seemed a bit smaller in portion, but it's got a lot of ingredients in it and not just the noodles. (Just maybe add a dash of salt) 
- last but not least, the dry-fried chicken wings were really good. Not sure if that's the name of the dish on the menu, but it's pretty much the translated name. It has a sweet glaze and spice sauce on it. The wings were pretty big in size and filling. The dish came with 10 wings and we were surprised. Yayy!!! Who doesn't love tasty wings! My mom doesn't eat spicy food, so we ordered it without the spice. Still tasty! 

Gonna come back and try some other dishes.
author: Helen W.

description:
The best Chinese Restaurant in San Francisco, hands down! I was born & raised in Chinatown, Los Angeles! I know my authentic Chinese food and can't be fooled! After trying just about every Chinese Restaurant in Chinatown SF & surrounding areas, I'm come to the conclusion that Chang's is by far the best in terms of quality and prices! 

My favorite dishes, Salt & Pepper Pork Chops, Singagore Noodles, General Tso Chicken, Deep fried spicy Tofu, Phoenix & Dragon Eggplant and many others....

Do not listen to the haters & negative reviews, you will not be disappointed at Chang's Restaurant! Also, if there is a dish you want custom made they will be more than happy to oblige...speak to the Lead Waiter, Mr. Lou!
author: Abel C.

description: Meh. It was okay. I was excited when I saw general tso chicken on the menu but it was soggy and not very flavorful. White rice was sticky and good. The egg roll with the meal was just ok, nothing special. Also, I asked for soy sauce and they gave me one packet which wasn't sufficient (imo) for the amount of rice I received. Maybe eating in is better than delivery?
author: Alexa S.

description:
You know those flyers you get in the mail, that no one ever pays attention to? That they hang on your door, or the flyers they put in those Value Pak blue envelopes for advertising local businesses? Chang did both of those techniques, and that's how I found out about the restaurant. When I saw it had 4 stars on yelp, I thought it would be worth a try!

My bf and I wanted take-out delivery. We ordered Yang Chow Fried Rice, Spicy Eggplant, and Sweet and Sour Pork. With the special (see below) we got the crab rangoons free too! Our total came out to around $30. The food was pretty good quality for Chinese food. The portions were big! We both ate that dinner, and still had leftovers for 2 more dinners after that. Not bad!

Specials:
-If you order $20 worth, you get free delivery (at least to our zip code, shout out to 94121!). 
-When you order $25 worth, you can get free crab rangoons (like crab & cream cheese deep fried wontons) or egg rolls. 
-If you order more than $30, you can get free fried rice or vegetable chow mein.

I'd suggest ordering on Yelp, since the process is a lot easier compared to their website, and it's easier to find the coupon specials. Delivery time was estimated to be 1 hour, but came within 40 mins. 

We're doing this take-out delivery thing more often!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Super fast delivery as I'm at a friend's nearby about 5 blocks. We ordered 5 vegan dishes and they threw in chowmein for free! Super good food and they really go heavy on the veggies so you actually feel good afterwards. Veggies were fat and plump and super fresh.

We got the "meatless" kung pao, orange chicken, and sweet and sour. Tender greens with mushrooms and garlic fried rice on the side. Chowmein for free.

The best dish was the Kung pao and chowmein! 

Oh and it's Christmas Eve!
author: Priya S.

description:
This is really meant to be 2.5.

Ordered the Szechuan beef with noodles. Broth looked super yummy but was tasteless so very disappointed but, the beef was super tender and melted in my mouth. I probably would have enjoyed it more with a different type of noodles and with some additional seasoning of my own. 

Also had the salt and pepper prawns. This was good but wish it would have been a little crispier.

Lastly, had the wontons with hot chilly sauce. This was super salty and I almost feel that mixing this soup with the broth from the Szechuan beef noodles would have fixed both dish since they were complete opposite in taste. Should have given it a go but unfortunately didn't.

Overall okay but probably wouldn't return.
author: Hello E.

description:
My father and I checked this place out a few months ago because we did not want to wait for a table across the street.  Boy, am I glad we did.

After beer, my second biggest guilty pleasure is chicken wings... and I have had them all over.

Chang's chicken wings are about the best I have had.  The are sweet, sticky and spicy.  They use good quality wings with lots of meat and they do not overcook them.  If they did not have any calories, I would be thin.  :)

The other food is also very solid - but then it better be -- after all this is the City.  We like the hot and sour soup and the sweet and sour prawns.  

Even better, they have free delivery, so if you don't have to deal with parking.  We order delivery often and they do a nice job.  The food comes fast and well packaged.

If order $25, you get free egg rolls or veggie chow mein.
author: Gary A.

description: Food was average. Ordered spring rolls and got egg rolls. Mushu pancakes were flour tortillas.
author: Tracy K.

description:
Ordered via Caviar.

I was sold because they have peking duck, which is my absolutely fricken favorite. I had the duck, bbq pork buns, rice, and requested a side of their Chinese broccoli in oyster sauce even though it wasn't on the Caviar menu. Everything was great.

I might even have given them five stars if they had butchered the duck away from the bone. They butchered it Chinese meat cleaver style, bones included, which makes it hard to eat. But it was delicious nonetheless.
author: Megan B.

description:
the food quantity on carry out orders is wayyy too small my mongolian chicken order was 80% onions and 20% chicken i am attaching pictures. 

The lady who runs the store was incredibly rude to me and refused to help me in any way. The gentleman, however, was very nice and at least was listening to what I had to say. I went back to the store to tell them about my order and the lady was horrible to me. The gentleman knows how to handle customers but the lady doesn't even have any common courtesy.

Seriously, do yourself a favor and go to San Tung's right across the street!!!
author: Monika G.

description:
We ended up in Chang's Kitchen because San Tung was closed for a week.  I was starving and didn't really want to spend time looking for a place.

Chang's Kitchen had the BEST Customer Service.  The help staff was attentive, humorous and energetic.  I heard a few tables comment on how great the customer service was, and I agree!

I ended up ordering dishes that I would normally get in San Tung, so maybe for starter that is not a really fair way to rate Chang's Kitchen.  First, their dishes are mostly chili oil based.. which was good for chili oil based dishes or what is known as Szechuan Dishes.

We ordered the sautéed green beans, dry fried chicken wings, mu shu chicken, and black bean noodle.  At first taste it was really good, but the brain started comparing to the flavors of San Tung..
author: Melinda R.

description: This place is delicious! Perfect if you're craving wings. The service is great. Everyone here is super nice. Whenever I'm craving wings this is my go-to place. I love Chang's kitchen
author: Carla T.

description:
This DELIVERY was outstanding! Not only was the food delicious (I'll get to that) but it was so fast that it seemed like 15-minutes including the delivery! I should be receiving the food now according to delivery norms, but it was delivered and I'm completely done eating and STUFFED! 

Look no further if you're really hungry and the food is great!  I ordered General Tso's Chicken (medium spicy) and it's superb! I have enough for 2 more meals as well! The Pork Potstickers were just like Mom used to make them. Delicious. (OK, I'm not Asian and Mom never made pot stickers, but we have dumplings in the eastern European food cultures too, ya know.) I ate two of those and have leftovers again. I have sipped on the excellent spinach mushroom soup -  flavorful! More for later since I'm stuffed. I placed one of the Shrimp Har Gow in my mouth and those are exceptional. I'm too full to continue!  I have plenty of left-overs. This would easily feed 3 hungry people. To top it off, they threw in 6 pcs of the Deep Fried Crab Rangoon.  YUM! 

LOVE THIS PLACE AND WILL ORDER AGAIN!
author: Dana J.

description: So great, lovely and friendly service. Me and my group of 20+ people dropped in last minute and they were so friendly to us. Also I haven't had this quality of genuine food in years.
author: Frank N.

description: Do not order from here! I found a fly in my chow mein at the bottom of my container which I had already ate some of it. This wasn't some house fly it was a huge fly that you can see it's legs and hairs! I've honestly never made a review on something but this was so disgusting that I had to warn people.
author: Briana R.

description: Chang's makes reliably delicious dim sum which holds up to delivery! I've actually never been to the location itself, but on weekend mornings my husband and I love to have dim sum delivered. We usually get the xiao long bao, har gao, and char siu bao--not too adventurous but always good, and I'm constantly impressed DoorDash gets us the soup dumplings still hot and usually only 1-2 pop (from an order of 10). One day we'll have to make it there in person!
author: Anika K.

description:
Scallop with egg white fried rice is great.  Not greasy at all.  The rice is just right, not too wet or too dry.  The portion is decent, good for two people.  But it doesn't have too much scallop.

Spareribs with special sauce is just so so.  The spareribs were over cooked.  Maybe it sat on too long before going to the table.  The spareribs was warm but not hot.

String beans with special sauce is yummy.  The dish is very fresh.
author: Flora Z.

description: Food was okay. However, I specificly said not to ring doorbell and bring the order to the garage downstairs, but they still ring the doorbell and bring the food upstairs.
author: Trang Y.

description:
Pretty greasy and not much in the way of flavor. 

Shang hi dumplings were pretty good.
author: Evan S.

description: Remarkable. I have been coming to "Beijing on Irving" now Changs Kitchen since I was a little boy. Food is always delicious and in my opinion better than what's across the street. The food here is more authentic to San Francisco and is not trendy. Lu, who seems to be everything there is an amazing host and always makes you feel more than welcome. Please come and dine on a foggy San Francisco night or even a nice warm night, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jeremiah S.

description: Just got a delivery from here and it was delicious. The fried wings were amazing. Will definitely be eating here again
author: Sean S.

description: Wasn't great this time around, and will likely not order again.  This was my second time ordering from here.  While the delivery was quick, so was the prep.  Meh indeed.
author: Matt D.

description:
* some delivery apps still call this "Golden Rice Bowl"; they really mean Chang's Kitchen *

sweet & sour meat, dumpling soup, fried rice. not memorable but not bad. was thankful to encounter it all laid out on the table when i got home from a not exactly filling $$$ dinner. xie xie!
author: Dan B.

description:
They give you free delivery service & egg fried rice with your meal! 
Decent portion, taste very fresh and clean. If you are craving Chinese food and think to call in for food delivery this is the right place!
author: Stella K.

description:
We ordered for delivery twice. First time was almost average. Decided to try them again. (Everyone has an off day) As a Bay Area native, I've been eating Chinese food all my life. (More than 40yrs) 

We ordered pot stickers (unusually soggy), chicken chow mein (C- grade on flavor), orange chicken (C- grade), green onion pancake (C- grade)

We will not be ordering from here again. Quantity gets them from a 2 star review to a 3 star. 
Good luck if you're going to try this place
author: Jonathan P.

description:
REVIEWER # 239

Chang's Kitchen never seems to fail me! This is my number one Chinese restaurant I go to when I am at work and craving some delicious and fresh food!

Chang's Kitchen offers decent prices and fresh food. Every time I have ordered here the food comes out piping hot! 

They are known for their popular and delicious Dry Fried Chicken Wings also known as "Crack" because they are too dang good! Chang's offers huge portions of food (big enough to serve 2 people) and fast delivery service (if needed).

The main food items that I have tried on their menu have been:
-BBQ Pork Fried Rice
-Shrimp Chow Main
-Fried Wonton with pork
-Steamed Rice
-General Tso's Chicken

Everything I have ordered has been delicious! I usually always order delivery because parking around the restaurant is not the easiest. When I ordered it usually takes an hour for my order to be delivered (the only bad con of this review is the long delivery service) but who can complain when you're not the one driving. FREE delivery up to a minimum order of $18. 

Would I order here again? YES! The food is delicious, portion size is VERY generous and the prices are reasonable!
author: Porsche C.

description: This review is for a won ton soup I picked up. I was really pleased that it was made with fresh vegetables- carrots, cabbage and celery! No canned mushrooms or bamboo shoots like the soup of my youth. The fresh ginger flavor came across in the wontons. Perfect for a cold. I will go back to check out the rest of the menu.
author: Susan B.

description:
This place= AMAZING! I had a crappy encounter with Ubereats but Chang's managed to come to the rescue and boy was I beyond pleased! :) Seriously, the best Chinese food I have had in a long time, but Jenny (I think that's her name) and her employees were the true cherry on top. Such kind people. 

I am a huge fan of family businesses and will absolutely support this place moving forward. Double thumbs up!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
I came with my dad who is quite a picky eater and we both loved the flavors in the dishes we ordered. I ordered the mildly spicy jajangmyun (beijing black bean paste noodle) and the other dish was a beef rice (can't recall but it had bitter melon in it but I tried the meat which was very tender and savory sweet). It's funny because I usually go across the street to San Tung, which is a very popular restaurant but it was closed so I decided to try this place. I am so happy that I finally came into this restaurant because the flavors were really great! The portion sizes are also very good for the price you pay. Overall, highly recommend and I actually would choose to come here over San Tung (which is really yummy for only a few select dishes but Chang's Kitchen seems to have more consistent yummy variety. I would definitely come back to try more items on the menu.). 

Place is clean, the service was also very nice and mellow. They speak english and chinese. Overall pleasantly surprised and absolutely would come again.
author: Angie C.

description:
Okay... I've always gone to San Tung growing up. However one day San Tung was closed so I decided to go to Chang's Kitchen and I have not stopped going ever since. The food is utterly delicious... not to mention the prices are pretty good. The 10 piece wings at San Tung is around $13 compared to $10 at Chang's Kitchen. Both of them are equally as good... and I personally feel that the wing sizes are bigger at Chang's Kitchen. 

You NEED to try the Mongolian beef chow mein. The beef is so tender and the noodles are always cooked perfectly. I think it's called the mango fish filet but it's fried and has this sweet and spicy batter and oml it is so delicious. Not to mention that the portion sizes are HUGE. The spicy string bean and pork is also a main staple and is just as delicious.
author: Sam L.

description: Great place, they always accommodate our order changes, friendly and have lots of vegetarian options.
author: J. L.

description: Bomb chow mein and great vegetarian options. They're a new go-to for delivery when I'm hungover or feeling lazy.
author: Jess M.

description: This place was second choice today but should've been first alll the food was hella bomb honey shrimp was on point spicy green beans won ton soup every thing was great fast and and good and are waiter was so cool I'm definitely coming back
author: Johnny V.

description: I have some bad news and some good news. Bad news is that there was something funky baked onto the vegetable buns, which I did not notice until after I started eating. Good news is that it looked more like sweater fuzz than human hair.
author: Itir S.

description:
This business is a JOKE. After my previous 1 star, I still ordered their chicken wings. The wings are sweet and blah blah blah. Here is the problem: what I can't stand is the stupid delivery guy who clearly is doing the wrong job. If you are in the hospitality business your JOB (the thing you get paid for) is to serve people. Don't expect to get paid more on top of your paycheck. If you aren't making enough, go find a different job or complain to your employer about it. Anyone who justifies tips as being a "thing" is feeding the stereotype that I am responsible for the well being of the servers and delivery people. 
I have lived in Asia and Europe and guess what: servers have a good life and we don't tip them. They have houses, cars, and kids and they are able to pay for everything with their jobs because the moment their paycheck doesn't make them happy, they complain about it with their freaking employer, not their paying customer (who btw, are making sure you get to keep your job). 
This is vent after the delivery guy said that driving 2 miles for 6 minutes is "far away" and I should tip him more. Should I also pay for your gas? and maybe calculate the freaking depreciation on your car? This idiot was loud and disruptive. Their food isn't good. I still order it because of the convenience. But after this experience, SCREW this business. If I have to pay to get shitty customer service, I'll keep my money for myself and cook.   


Here is a message for the manager and owners of this restaurant: make sure your employees are happy before you send them over to my house.
author: Ashish N.

description: Not bad. I ordered takeout online. The food was ready when I got there. The owner was very friendly. Food was in large portion and tasted fresh. That was what I was expecting.
author: Jacky C.

description:
Went here for a family lunch and luckily there was seating available. The size of the restaurant is perfect for families and groups. Also, kids! The food was really, really good. We ordered a bunch of food (way too much for lunch, I admit) but everything was really yummy!

I also really liked their service. Everyone was really nice and made sure you left satisfied. I think it's a family owned restaurant (?) 

I highly recommend!!
author: Patricia A.

description: Great service! I would definitely come back. I am giving 4 stars because the wonton soup was bland. If they could touch that up a bit then 5 stars all the way
author: Mickey B.

description: Great food, great service except they do not have AC. Price is not bad, place is clean. However, dont go unless it is a cool day (we came on a hot day -- excessive heat warning in the area. We are only visiting the NorCal area and noticed all the restaurants on this street have no AC). We ordered 7 dishes and fried rice, everything was excellent.
author: Jen M.

description: I ordered online and the food came really quickly and was still hot! The items I got was the dry fried chicken wings, sauteed string beans, chicken fried rice, and the general chicken. The portions were enough for 4-5 people and there were no left overs!! I really enjoyed the food here, I would definitely come again!!
author: Yao Chun L.

description: We will there for my friend graduation lunch to my surprise the food was so good we finished everything on the plate the people were so nice we were a huge group and asking for water napkins sugar soda they always say yes and refill our glasses I highly recommended
author: Louie L.

description: I only came here because San tung which is right across the street was closed on a Thursday. I had their dry fried wings and dumplings. The dumplings were decent! I was skeptical of the wings but it wasn't bad!! it was a little too sweet for me and not spicy at all. I wish San tung had been open but chang's is a great alternative. staff is really friendly as well
author: Stella C.

description: The restaurant is very clean and awsome. The food is great. One  of the best Chinese food i ever had. Their  tofu king salmon fillet is super good.
author: Xiao H.

description: Amazing food! We ordered the Tofu with Garlic Sauce (Spicy), General Tso's Chicken, and the Spicy Vegetable Chow Fun. We both agreed that the Tofu was the best thing we ordered! It came with carrots and onions, but I asked for broccoli instead of onions. The service was fast, and friendly. Our waiter was also really funny and joked around with us. He constantly refilled our water without us having to ask and checked in with us several times. We will be back!
author: Bernie S.

description:
It was Sunday around 1 pm and a beautiful sunny day. A few friends and I wanted to grab a bite and the consensus  was Chang's Kitchen. We decided to carpool. Two cars total. We parked about five blocks away and walked. I didn't mind because it was, once again, a beautiful sunny day.

We had reserved a table and they accommodated our party of 12 as per our reservation. Good stuff. I looked around, it wasn't necessarily packed but it wasn't necessarily empty either. The staff came promptly to take our order. After taking our orders, the staff hung back and stood around surveying the restaurant. The food came fast and hot. Wait a minute... we had ordered rice but where were our rice bowls? "Excuse me, can we get 12 rice bowls?" I asked. "Why do you need rice bowls? Can't you eat rice on your plates?" was the response. Me and my friends were taken aback. Never have we experienced this at a restaurant before. Never mind. The food is here, we'll eat the rice on our plates to prevent further commotion. 

The day proceeded as we had otherwise planned. Good food, good company. Chicken wings, Ma Po tofu, Mongolian beef, string beans and a couple of other miscellaneous run of the mill Asian dishes. It was good, my hunger was satiated. A few minutes passed by like seconds and it was already time for the check.  We had leftovers. "Can we get a takeout box?" It was me who asked once again since i also spoke Cantonese, which the staff of this restaurant spoke. "....." No answer. She proceeded to take away our food and our plates, never to be seen again. Once again, our friends and I were dumbfounded. 

At the end of it all, we ate, we paid and we left. Good riddance.
author: Wing C.

description: Had a bad experience with a restaurant down the street and came to Chang's Kitchen after leaving and I was so happy to receive great service after what I had just experienced. Everyone is so nice and welcoming the food was amazing they definitely changed my mood around! Thank you Chang's we will be coming back soon!
author: Nancy H.

description: I work for a company that has an account with this restaurant n every time im here i always have to get the sweet n sour pork!!!!! It is one of the best dishes as far as sweet n sour go... They keep a clean kitchen as well seeing that i go in the back to do service..staff is friendly atmosphere is calm and the food is delicious..if ur n the area def check them out!!!!!!
author: Kyle M.

description:
Great lunch special prices in the neighborhood and nice portions. Lunch specials come with soup and an egg roll. Their Mongolian beef is pretty good! Same with fish filet & bok choy rice plate (asked to replace corn). Hits the spot when I'm craving comfort food! 

Been to my fair share of Chinese restaurants growing up, and the service and cleanliness of the dining area here is exceptional..everyone is so nice, warm and welcoming. The owner (?), Lou, is super friendly, funny (been cracking jokes since I sat down), and remembers his regulars. Been here 2-3 times for lunch and it's like the Cheers of Chinese restaurants, where Lou knows your name. 

Their lunch menu includes the standard fare of Americanized Chinese food (sesame chicken, general Cho's, broccoli beef, etc.), but they also have some Chinese-style dishes (tomato beef, scrambled eggs with prawns, etc.) Saw some Chinese contractors feasting here for lunch..so I know there are legit authentic dishes I need to try here with my family one day!

Thanks, Lou!! I'll be back :)
author: Liz L.

description:
Food arrived really quickly. (We have a child so we usually have dinner around 5ish).
We ordered the usual.. Mongolian beef : was a little too much add-ons and very little beef, with quite a bit of tendon, Orange chicken : bit too much batter, String beans were okay but the wonton soup was delicious though..can't go wrong with that. 
Overall, back up restaurant if our usual isn't open.
author: Dee F.

description:
Stopped by here after a visit to the science center. We had the Har Gow, Bao, Sesame Balls, Fried Bananas, and Sesame chicken. 

Har Gow: Wow. It was a taste sensation.  It tasted so fresh and was so large. It was just amazingly well done. 

BBQ Bao: The dough was soo fluffy and just melted in your mouth. The insides were oh so tasty. 

Sesame Balls: I didnt get to taste any of these - they (my party) ate them before i got to them but they looked really delicious. 

Fried Bananas: They are cut sort of like Banana chips but not like banana chucks, that have been deep fried then chocolate sauce is drizzled all over them. The warm fluffy banana just disappears into your mouth and the sweetness of the chocolate brings out the sweetness in the banana. 

Sesame chicken: It was ok, not much to say.

We did not make it to Chinatown, but to us it was a great and delicious meal. Especially the dim sum.
author: Melody B.

description: The waiters here are wonderful! I haven't even tried the food yet, but the waiter has been wonderful!
author: Danica Dei J.

description: Long story short, ordered delivery and food came within 20 min. Found no beef in my chow fun, and barely any seafood in my other order. Called back and they said they would deliver the beef to me but took 45 min. Food didn't taste that good either. Wish I had more hands to give them 4 thumbs down.
author: Kenny L.

description:
Came here cause the wait at San Tung across the street was just too long, even after arriving just 20 minutes after San Tung had just opened. 

The owners and workers in the restaurant were all very gracious and friendly. While I really want to give a higher review, the food wasn't to die for.

My friend and I both agreed it really hit the spot for our Chinese food craving because it's truly authentic. It also came out extremely fast, which was a miracle for our hungry souls. 

We ordered the chicken curry, string beans with fried tofu, and combination chow fun. The fried tofu was mouthwatering, but the string beans could've been cooked a bit longer. The chow fun didn't have as much protein as we would've liked, but it was good nonetheless. The portions were large, and it's definitely a good spot for some real Chinese food.

Oh also, the fortune cookie's fortune that I received after the meal was scarily accurate in relation to me! Found that pretty interesting
author: Lillian C.

description: 20 minutes for delivery when ordered on a Saturday at 6:15 pm?! I don't really need much more than that! But...the food is always good and hot!
author: Austin S.

description: Ordered takeout and received the order with no utensils or chopsticks. Very frustrating.
author: Rotem N.

description: Chang's kitchen has great vegetarian dishes, rice, and spring rolls. It's hard to find restaurants like Changs' that understands how to cook the meatless al dente. We dig it. ;-)
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Super nice owners and i finally tried their dry fried wings like san tungs and i have to say I AM STILL THINKING about them! They are way better than San Tung's! 

CRACK WINGS at CHANG's KITCHEN!

Cheaper, juicery and definitely more flavorful with less sauce.

LOVE!

I WANT MORE :)
author: Carol Y.

description:
This restaurant definitely need more reviews! Their spicy chicken wing is amazing, and they offer lots of delicious looking and tasting food! 

The service is good too, followed by quick serving time.
author: Aria R.

description: Fast delivery. We ordered 4 lunch plates for less then 40$!! Generous amounts of rice and meat. :)
author: Cameron A.

description:
Not gonna lie, we were originally going to San Tung but it was closed so we looked across the street and ended up here. Boy am I glad we stopped by! 

Came here on a Wednesday afternoon around 2pm Not too crowded - our party of 5 was seated right away which pleased my grandparents. Food came out very quickly, portions were generous, and the service was amazing -- our waiter was extremely gracious and attentive, and even set down dishes and teapots gently, a rarity in Chinese restaurants. 

Dry Fried Chicken Wing: ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!! Not the typical kind of thing we order from a Chinese restaurant, but they were hot, crispy and sweet on the outside, and savory on the inside. Wings were meaty, not those dainty bony wings that make you feel ripped off. Comes with a side of steamed broccoli to make you feel better about yourself for eating fried chicken. Yummy yummy definitely would order again

House Special Chow Mein: flavorful and hot. Just a tad on the oily side but that just means you get to slurp the noodles more easily

Shanghai Styled Rice Cake: honestly pretty same flavor as the house special chow mein, but with rice cake. Also delicious and chewy and hot, with a bit too much oil for my taste. 

Minus one star for the MSG headache afterwards. I'd definitely come by again if I was in the neighborhood and itching for more chicken wings.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Found this restaurant four stars in yelp. Food I rate four stars & services is five plus. It is very busy on Tuesday night(lots to go order). With only two people working, we still get very good services.  The lamb is very good! The pictures taken after we eaten half. Reason price & good services.
author: Linda T.

description: This place is an adequate chinese delivery place for those nights when you don't want to cook and cheap chinese food would really hit the spot.  We enjoy standards such as chow mein, honey walnut prawn and sautéed broccoli.  I would not hesitate to recommend this place to friends - and I have!
author: lucy w.

description: For several years my family and I have been eating and ordering take out at Chang's since it was named Golden Rice Bowl.  Lu is AWESOME, he is so friendly and accommodating every time we come in.  Most of our orders are usually for catering and we love the chicken and veggie chow mein.  We have tried most of the dishes and they are all very tasty and the quality is consistent. Great neighborhood gem!
author: Prof. X.

description:
Chang's kitchen is hands down my favorite place to order food from. Here's why:

-food is absolutely delicious
-great portion sizes
-super cheap, I get two meals for $22 (and that's including delivery/tax) 
-friendly staff
-DELIVERY TIME IS ALWAYS UNDER 30 MIN. I thought the first few times were a fluke, but now I've ordered over 10 times and realize they are just incredibly efficient - even when ordering for big groups

10/10 best Chang for your buck
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Food wasn't great. Egg rolls, siu mai, and pork buns were inedible and disgusting. I spit them out. Crab rangoon, potstickers and fried shrimp appetizers were decent. String beans with tofu and walnut tofu were both bland and weird. General Tsos meatless chicken was OK. No pot sticker sauce or sweet & sour sauce was provided for the appetizers, rendering them even more inedible. Won't be ordering from here again.
author: Josh P.

description: Delivery driver asked aggressively for his tip. Like, held my food hostage until I forked it over level aggressive. Then I came to find that the extra sweet and sour sauce I had asked for twice was not included. No sweet and sour sauce at all. Cool.
author: Christianna G.

description: This has just become one of my probably favorite places to go to. The food is delicious and the service is amazing! So glad I went here with my family--it was a such a great experience!
author: Katie S.

description:
Disappointment city man. Why all the great reviews?

I just ordered and got three soggy spring rolls, bland chow fun, and weird chicken and bland kung pao. i'm SO not impressed. i'll probably wind up throwing the rest of it (more than half) away. The person on the phone and the delivery guy were nice at least.

what happened to all of the decent affordable chinese delivery in SF?

i miss ha's so so much. (so much)

chang's leaving my phone's contact list almost as fast as it went in. 
save your money, go/order elsewhere, or like bland and soggy food. 
disappointed.
author: Wendy X.

description: We came here after stopping by San Tung only to find out they were closed. The beef chow mein and General Tso's chicken are fireee and the owner is super friendly as well! Definitely recommend if you are in the area
author: Mohamed A.

description: Good food and big menu. Take out orders are ready quickly. But they charged $2 to add three smaller pieces of broccoli to my Mongolian Beef order.
author: Justin F.

description: Honestly the food was average but the owners and servers make up for it. They are super nice and sweet. Chowmein was good.
author: Megna S.

description: The food is really bad. I ordered several things. The meatless chicken was probably the worst veggie meat dish I've ever had. So many SF places get this one right, but this place isn't one of them.  It was salty, tasteless, rubbery and just plain weird and in no way resembled chicken. The shrimp chow mein was soggy and had two pieces of shrimp. The string beans were oily and overcooked. Btw, everything was oily, but I would've looked past it if it was tasty. The walnut shrimp were alright, but way too much batter, and not ok enough to make up for how bad everything else was. The plain rice was what it's supposed to be and the delivery was fast. Yay. $50 worth of 1-star food. I threw everything away with the exception of walnut shrimp and plain rice. Sorry, but these guys don't live up to their current 4-star rating. :( Life is too short to be eating this stuff.
author: Tatyana V.

description:
Just all around good food here. We ordered for delivery over the weekend and service was fast, the delivery guy was super polite and the food was the bomb. We ordered Mongolian Beef, Honey Walnut Prawns, Sweet & Sour chicken and the Spicy Garlic mushroom fried rice. They have an awesome special that if you order more then $#0 - you can choose from a few free items. We got the vegetable chow mein. 

YUM.
author: Cat G.

description:
Was on my way to San Tungs but found this place across the street after I found out San Tungs closes on Wednesday. Was the best find on Irving. The owners are the sweetest people ever. I only ever get their chicken wings and they are yummy to say the least. 

Came here for my birthday dinner and ordered a party platter of 100 wings for 13 people Tip: Nobody needs a 100 wings, I recommend getting the M or L party platter instead.
author: Laureano F.

description:
So I wanted to go to a Chinese restaurant in the Sunset area, and San Tung was on the list as a 4 star place and I was like oooh I wanna go there! :O But as we parked, paid for the 30 minute parking( after 6pm is free), we found out that they were on vacation. NOOO. SOB. How could they be on vacation? :(

So we walked across the street to Chang's Kitchen and we read the reviews there as well. It didn't seem too bad and decent enough and so we gave it a try. We came in and got a table for 4 and saw that most of their orders were for pick up, rather than for in store. It does have a lot of housing around, so I can see them just picking up and going home to the family for dinner.

Sat down, got wonton strips with sweet and sour sauce, which I liked haha. The reviews said to get the chicken wings, and indeed we did. Chicken wings were good. Like the sauce around was excellent. It was a tad spicy and was sweet and had a lot of sauce. Finger lickin' good. The inside was moist, rather than dry, so that was good as well.

The rice ovalets- not enough sauce. Wayyyy too little sauce. They had longer elongated rice ovalets and had mushrooms, carrrots, and cabbage with some pork. It was "healthy" it seemed, I guess but just not enough sauce.

Garlic beef- This one was really good. Had good sauce, had peas (yay vegetables) and would have gone great if we had bowls of rice( they offered, we declined).

Food comes out reasonably quickly, service was good, as they can speak both Canto and English. At night, you can watch them prepping for the next day, as they were peeling pea ends on a table in the back. 

If San Tung is busy, give Chang's a try! I haven't had S.T. yet so I can't compare them together yet :(
author: Raymond L.

description: First, my son said if he can rate this a zero he would. This is by far the worst customer service and food he has ever experienced. He was pressed to add a second tip. The lady stood by my son and did not move until he tipped her. I just wish I was there...this is crazy how this grown as lady stood asking for a tip. He food was cold...nasty and questionable. He threw away his food.   Stop begging for a tip..pressuring kids to tip and serving nasty as food. Run Forest Run..do not go to this nasty infested place. You suck!!!!
author: Lou R.

description: We were disappointed and found the food very bland.  We ordered chicken with green beans, beef chow fun and Korean spare ribs. The ingredients seemed good, with a nice variety of vegetables in each dish, yet they were all strangely tasteless. Given all the 5 star reviews, this restaurant seems to have found a niche, but it's not for me.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
Super fast delivery. Ordered on Sunday, July 5th a little before 7pm. Our ordered arrived a bit over 35 mins later. Placed our dinner order through delivery dot com as we had a $5 credit.

*Dry fried chicken wings ($9.75): hot and spicy
Lately I've been disappointed with San Tung's chicken wings as they've been sweet and not much else. Where's the spice?! These actually hit the spot! A great combination of garlicky spice with a hint of sweetness.

*Sauteed string beans ($8.25): hot and spicy
Not really as spicy as I wanted. I like a little heat to counteract the pickle and sweetness.

*Shanghai steamed dumpling ($7.50): 10
Yum! Still arrived soupy. The wrapper had a great texture while the filing was nice and meaty.

*Fresh basil chicken ($8.95): hot and spicy
The roommate ordered this one. It was like an oily mess! I almost wanted to call it an affront to Chinese food! The only redeeming thing was it had some spice.

*Bbq pork fried rice ($6.95): no carrots
The best fried rice I've had in a while! The rice was the perfect texture. And a great savoriness from the bbq pork.

*Wonton soup ($4.95 small)
Standard wonton soup. The wonton wrappers were a little too thick for my liking, but the soup had subtle flavor.

Out of what we ordered, the Chang's Kitchen solid dishes were the wings, XLB and fried rice. The rest of the dishes were just average with the basil chicken being a definite miss! Next time I'm craving soup dumplings and crack wings, I'm glad I have an option that delivers for free!
author: Elena N.

description: Food isn't that good and way too much rice 80% rice 20% chicken delivery took 1.5 hours and I live 10 blocks away. Driver was kinda rude (and other comments say they demanded tips) I gave a couple dollars so I had no issue with that. The sweet and sour sauce I asked for weren't there (saw someone else say that too) won't be ordering from them again waste of time and money
author: Felisha P.

description:
Came here,  naturally because sang tung was closed. No one else was here,  so was a bit skeptical. 

We ordered the spring rolls to start.  They were very delicious.  They also brought us Jasmine tea which was very good. 

For dinner we got the kung pao chicken and the chow mein. The kung pao was not bad,  a little greasy but pretty good. The chow mein however was AMAZING.  Probably the best I've ever had. You should give this place a chance.  I would say they're as good as across the street.
author: Arman J.

description: their spicy beef noodle is very good, with generous portion of beef covered with chili oil.  The service was very good too.
author: Haoran C.

description:
Came by after finding Yummy Yummy had a line at 8PM on a Sunday. Didn't bother with San Tung because they use too much sugar in place of MSG. Yummy Yummy food does that too in the last few years to compete I suppose and it was the reason why we didn't go back, but tonight we just wanted to see if things changed. I've seen Chang's open up across the street, but never bothered with it. Tonight, we decided to look at the menu and we have them a shot.

Place was fairly clean and hardly decorated. The staff were nice and we were seated immediately in a mostly empty dining room. We ordered a few things, here's how it went:

Chicken Corn Soup. Basic and decent, but too much starch. It was almost on the brink of ruining the soup. Flavor was there. They need to refine this.

Buddha's Delight. Tofu cubes tossed with rice noodles, mushrooms, celery, black fungus and snow peas was good. I've seen better presentation, but it tasted about as good as the one I had with the more interesting presentation, so it doesn't matter. I would order this again.

House Special Fried Rice. Decided to get this instead of buying white rice by the bowls. It had shrimp, chicken and pork bits. It was good and that's not a bad rating on the dish. It means I would order it again. It didn't blow me away and it didn't disappoint me.

General Tso's Chicken. This... Wonderfully prepared! Not too sweet, not too salty, not drenched in sauce, but could be more spicy for Asian customers. Nice sized chunks of chicken in a wonderful crunchy fried batter. Excellent. I would surely come back just for this.

This restaurant was stumbled upon among stiff competition on the block. As everyone else will stand in line for those diabeetus restaurants, I'll happily walk past them all and get seated easily in this overshadowed gem. Recommended.
author: Bor C.

description:
The food is swimming in oil. I ordered the Twice Cooked Pork and it was 60% oil, 20% cabbage and 20% pork. Also ordered a meatless option of Kung Pao and it's not wheat meat (vegetarian option that tastes like chicken) but tofu instead (it tasted good though!)

Also, the guy that delivered yelled (yes, he literally shouted at me) regarding the tip and how I should be more generous.

Probably will not order from here again.
author: Aditi G.

description: The taste was ok the egg rice was skimpy on the egg and vegetables the general's chicken was too sweet & too much sauce not enough vegetables. Sorry!
author: Rosemarie D.

description:
Bland food and too oily...even for Chinese food. 
We ordered cashew chicken,  it had a strong taste of garlic. Mongolian beef was in a lot of chili oil, and the chow mein had no taste
The dry chicken wings were good
author: Orlaigh C.

description:
Good times at Chang's!!!

It was lunchtime and I needed something to eat. I wanted some Chinese food and this place came to mind. I saw that they have online ordering so I went on ahead to the website to place the order. The menu is GREAT! The food here looks really good. I went straight to the lunch menu to begin looking for what I wanted. The lunch menu is well priced and they offer a LOT of stuff to choose from. I was tempted to grab something from the Chef's Special but instead I went on ahead with the Mongolian chicken, a very wise choice.

Shortly after I placed the order I headed on over. It took roughly 15 minutes to get over to the restaurant. I found parking across the street which was perfect!!! I walked over after I parked and took a moment to look at the menu in the window, WOW! All the pictures made me hungry. This place has some really GOOD food. I thought about getting something else to add to my lunch but I chose to just get my food. 

I went inside and saw that this place was not busy yet. I thought noon time would mean lots of customers but it looked like I had gotten here before the rush! I went on up to the counter and told them the greeter that I was picking up an order. To my surprise my food was ready and waiting for me. This was surprising because the confirmation email that I received told me that my food would be ready in 45 minutes! It pays to get here early. I talked with one of the gentleman that works here, he may be the owner but I am not sure! I told him that I typically go to San Tung and he laughed and said, "Oh no, you should come here from now on". He is a funny guy! After I paid for my food I headed to my ride and booked towards my house. After making a few more stops I finally made it home.
