I laid out my food and opened the box. Cool, the food smelled good and I was excessively hungry. The meal, exquisite in every way imaginable! Great blend of spices and peppers which created a dynamic taste for this meal. I should have asked for more soy sauce though but I was able to manage with one packet. 

CHECK THIS PLACE OUT! There is plenty of seating here if you decide to come with a large party as well. Or just order online and get some take out. 

#kitcheninthename #cookingistheirgame #hotplate #can'twait
author: Robert F.

description:
Just ordered for the first time, what a great find!  Spot on delivery time based on estimated arrival of 8:11pm 
Order:
*Beef & Black Bean Chow Fun - the picture looked overly sauced so I added "light sauce please" to the notes. They listened...maybe too well. Good smoky, funky black bean taste, plenty of meat, a few fresh veggies for good measure but touch more sauce needed. Next time I'll just take it as they see fit. 
*Yang Chow Fried Rice - Shrimp! Several plump, juicy shrimp! Nice light stir fry, not greasy with a good variety of veg, chicken and SHRIMP!
*Salt & Pepper Chicken Wings - fat little drums & flats. Crispy despite being in a box or delivery. Don't overlook the garlicky jalapeño cabbage hiding at the bottom of said box. Mighty tasty on the fried rice. (The menu says 6 pieces, we got 8)
*Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce - a lot of crisp cooked tasty greens. Again asked for light sauce, perfect for this
*Bonus FREE Egg Fried Rice - didn't try yet, still loving on those plump little shrimp. I'm sure it'll be great with a fried egg tomorrow.  
Oh, and the nice delivery guy...great smile!
Will definitely order again.
author: Us And J.

description:
If I could I would give zero stars . Ordered they eats24 order got there and driver try to charge me again even tho I had paid
Online already . Than demanded a tip with a min of $5 hmmm no you can't not demand a tip. Got here late. And he was just plain rude.
author: Yolanda J.

description:
I wish I could give Chang's five stars, but I have some reservations that I cannot readily access in my memory. I really enjoy most of their food, and I am particularly fond of the dry fried chicken wings, (as are most patrons.) The mushu is not seasoned enough, but the salt and pepper pork chops are tasty and tender.  Love them.  The twice cooked pork, the fried fish with any sauce is lovely, and the spicy wontons are fun. Considering that it can be SO difficult to  eat at, or even order from San Tung, or San Tung 2, Chang's is a wonderful option.  Oh, and guess what....they deliver!
More power to them.
author: janice s.

description:
On our way driving from LA back home to Vancouver, BC, we decided we would take a detour and go to San Francisco. We heard about the fabulous wings at San Tung and decided it was worth the detour. Unfortunately, we didn't think to check if they were open or not... we saw a sign on the door saying that they were closed for a couple weeks for a vacation. Oh man!! Were we ever disappointed! At this point we were hungry and willing to go anywhere, so we went across the street just to get anything in our systems.

We were greeted promptly and seated by a friendly server. I decided to order the black pepper steak short ribs and the dry fried wings. I was determined to get wings, even if I couldn't have San Tung's! The black pepper short ribs were great. I've had much more tender short ribs back home but these were tasty and it was a good portion for the price. The wings though, they were fantastic! They were perfectly sweet, without being too sweet, and were moist! Yum! 

We were pleasantly surprised and left happy and full. Highly recommend their wings!
author: Ashley Y.

description:
Honestly, this place could be a lot better. I tried their 'chicken' chow mien, which wow.. wasn't chicken. the meat flaked like fish and tastes like fish. I went to them to show them and while not listening to me they said it is chicken and just sent me on my way. 

Now assuming this is fish chow mien, this chow mien itself is so bland, there is no flavor except salt and chili spice. 

This place is really low end, and low quality. You will get food (good quantity), but the quality is really low
author: Parth K.

description:
Well ok... I typically don't leave reviews unless something was stellar or absolutely horrendous. Unfortunately, this is the latter.

Where to start...

Came home hungry as ****, so ready to feast on some good Chinese food (cheat day lol). Well, they got my order wrong. Or rather, the free crab rangoons I got via coupon, they replaced with a veggie chow mein... without notice? Ok, fine. I got more food than I ordered (albeit, bland, plain chunk of empty carbs). Well, GT was hard, no meat inside, even the sauce was not enough to get it soggy lol... next up, salt/pepper pork... who just batters and fries pork with all the bones?!?! I almost cried accidentally chewing on my first bite so hard that my teeth were agonizing and my tongue in utter shock from the bone that poked it. Mongolian beef... well... I'll just call it soy-sauced runny beef. lol I got GT and MB because they were highly "recommended" by everyone... I am starting to lose faith in those that apparently call themselves "foodies".

My cheat day is ruined, and I just could not eat the whole thing anymore. I threw out all of them after the painful meal. I never throw food out and eat them all because that's how I grew up ("you have to finish your food or God will make you eat all of them in hell"). But this... I just can't. This I won't eat in hell either.

I'm already having digestion problems from eating something against my will + all the grease that's slowing it down.

What a waste of money. I am so pissed. I worked my butt all week waiting for a cheat day, and it got ruined. Should've just got kalua pork, donkatsu or donburi elsewhere like I usually do.
author: Eryn K.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE! I ordered from this restaurant, I got the general tso chicken, the pork buns, and some chow mein. I've had severe food poisoning for the past 4 days. I have never felt more sick than I have after eating this meal.
author: John W.

description: I know San Tung across the street gets all the hype, but this place is great too! I haven't done a side-by-side comparison of the wings yet but who goes to a Chinese restaurant and just gets wings?! I tried Chang's Mongolian Beef chow mein, Shanghai dumplings and few other dishes and everything was quick and delicious. The staff were a bit disorganized but friendly and attentive. Most importantly, unlike so many Chinese restaurants in Chinatown the meat in their dishes is sketchy or gritty, fresh and tender the way its supposed to be.
author: Gabriella M.

description:
Went here on Labor Day because the line at SanTung 2 was too long. One of the ST2 waitresses shouted into the crowd, "I've heard Chang's has good wings too." We trusted her. We shouldn't have. 

The food all sort of tasted the same, and was overly greasy and sweet. The wings were not even close to the ones at SanTung... They weren't terrible, but definitely weren't comparable either. 

The redeeming quality here was that the service was very friendly and good. SanTung often feels like a "high pressure" dining situation due to the crowds. If you just want some sweet Chinese food in a calm atmosphere, Chang's would be right up your alley.
author: Lauren C.

description:
What??? A place that makes dry fried chicken wings just like San tung?? I'm sold!!! 

Parking - tough....I'll tell ya! I know it's a busy street but I had to circle around the block a couple times even though it was noon!! Keep your eyes peeled at all times for a spot or else someone behind you could swoop it from right under ya! 

Service - great!!! The staff is all very nice and friendly. Especially the older waiter! I didn't catch his name but he really is sweet and does everything with a smile.

Food - surprisingly delicious! I got the dry fried chicken wings lunch special and it comes with 7 wings, a scoop of white rice, vegetable egg roll, a side of small broccoli, and soup. Portion size was really generous...especially with the price being so cheap too! I gotta say that the wings are really good...nice crisp to them and glazed with just the right amount of sweetness. 

...I definitely will be back!
author: Coco L.

description:
Ordered from Eat24 one night after a lazy weekend. Got the orange chicken, sizzling prawn platter, fried rice, and kung pao shrimp, and every dish was inedible. The dishes with shrimp were funky, all the dishes were dripping in grease, and the orange chicken was soggy, despite coming fairly quickly. 

Never again.
author: Tom F.

description: This place is awesome cause there is no wait like at San Tung and the food is just as good. We had the salt and pepper wings, won ton and chili cause and a fried rice. Everything came out hot and fresh and the cost was very reasonable. Honestly I came here only because So was closed and Sang Tung had a huge wait, but I was pleasantly surprised and this place blew away my expectations. I will definitely come here again on my own.
author: Joshua Y.

description: I used Chang's Kitchen to cater for an event at school and was glad I chose them! Their prices are pretty decent and the food is great quality! For a group of about 35 ppl we ordered a large fried rice, large sweet and sour kitchen and a medium eggplant dish. Everything came out to about $170! My order was a little short notice but they were able to get it ready for the next day, and now that I think about it, it was Valentine's Day! Very impressive! Everyone was really impressed by the food! The service was great! The employees were very accommodating and greeted me so warmly when I walked into pick up the food. They even helped me carry it all out! I would definitely order from here again!
author: Jessica B.

description: This is my go-to spot for good Chinese delivery. The food is always good and the vegetables are always fresh and crunchy just as I like them, never over cooked or greasy. Hope they keep up the good work!
author: Stella D.

description: Good lunch, we enjoyed the kung poa lunch and sesame chicken lunch. We added a chow fun chicken noodles.  We were served in 10min
author: Jose S.

description:
I ordered the General Tso's Chicken. The portion size was great and had zucchini and bell peppers in it which was a different touch. The breading on the chicken wasn't too heavy, and the sauce was perfectly spicy. The Deep Fried Crab Rangoon was also delicious and perfect for sharing. Loved those two items!

However, I was deeply disappointed with the Green Onion Pancakes. These are by far the worst I have ever had. They claim they are homemade, but when I took a bite...the pancake was hard as a rock and VERY stale. These were either way overcooked, or a couple days old. Either way, they were impossible to eat. I tried to bend one and it snapped in half like a burnt cookie! I am shocked they would serve food in this condition. It was horrible.

Since this order was for takeout, I was expecting some takeout utensils but there were none. No napkins, forks, or chopsticks. Just a couple packets of soy sauce. 

I really wanted to like this place because I needed a new Chinese takeout spot. But was extremely let down from the Green Onion Pancakes. It also would have helped to have some utensils since this order was to go. I'll give this place another try since I liked most of their food. Hopefully the Green Onion Pancakes will be fresh next time.
author: Chisholm T.

description:
This place that I would thought it's good but came out that wasnt so good because I order one of the soups that got my friend really sick, in the soup was way too oily and some of the meat wasn't fully cook all the way, and you guy claim it's fresh everyday? And completely fully cook? 
Also I order the tai chow fun, it's doesn't have any flavor, I'm basically eating the food raw like it's didn't even cook at all!
What a lie, I will never order from this place again
 
If you guy still want continue to have good business, you guy should of change or improve the food better, other wise I recommend you guy should stop the business because you guy doesn't even care to give good customer service!
author: Conny T.

description: Nice family style cooking. Just right for everyday dining. I live nearby and this has been my regular diner whenever I'm rushed in time. The food is cooked just right, seems much care in preparation. Good food, right price, best neighborhood dining.
author: Bill C.

description: Super duper fast delivery. (Admittedly, I live 3 blocks away.) I've also had good pickup experiences but I've never dined in here. It's basic American(ized) Chinese food. Tasty, never had a dish I didn't enjoy. Fair prices and good portions. It's not gourmet or avant garde. There's really not a whole lot to say, except that if you know what you're in for, you will almost assuredly be happy when you're done eating.  After downing all that salt and fat, you're gonna  feel like you can take on the world!
author: Jason G.

description: I came to the area for a different restaurant and ended up coming to this place instead. Great authentic Cantonese cuisine. This is not just coming from me, but my mother---who is the pickiest critic when it comes to authentic Chinese food. Loved the house special beef chow fun! We will be coming back again!
author: Scoot G.

description: This is becoming my favorite delivery place as far as good Chinese food. This place is just across the street from the overcrowded San Tung but Changs Kitchen does delivery and San Tung doesn't . Changs Kitchen dry chicken wings are fantastic. The Hunan chicken & prawns are yummy. When it rains Changs Kitchen delivers delicious food.
author: Juan V.

description: I love Chinese food but unfortunately I don't exercise enough to burnout the carbs of these delectable dishes. So, when I rarely go for Chinese food it better be darn good and worth every bite! I ordered takeout since I had a large family to feed from the fire evacuations. The food arrived at a decent acceptable time, quicker than I was told. All the dishes were packaged in reusable plastic containers, which I loved because no leakages of sauce everywhere and they even placed reinforced plastic bags  over heavily sauced dishes. The food was fresh, seasoned well (not salty), tasty, hot, delicious and cooked with the exact amount of spiciness since some guest prefer mildly spicy. All 10 dishes were accounted for, I hate when a dish is missing! Chang's is definitely on my "bookmarked list" for Chinese food.
author: Maxie P.

description:
Quite befuddled at the high reviews on this page: my experience at Chang's was quite disappointing. Like everyone else, I went here when San Tung was closed. It appears that in some ways, this is San Tung's grandson or younger cousin - when it really just lacks anything close. Of course, if you're looking for cheap Chinese, I suppose this could work. However...

...the food is absolutely disappointing. The lunch special is your traditional Chinese restaurant lunch special - hot-and-sour soup, rice, your entree, and a fortune cookie. I got the Kung Pao Prawns, and counted five prawns on a massive dish. To make matters worse, the "Kung Pao" sauce was just slathered on hot sauce that was numbing spicy, and the vegetables were hardly cooked down (the celery and bell peppers all had a raw, bitter snap to them - a sign that they had barely been cooked). Additionally, the celery (who puts celery in Kung Pao dishes) was cu way too big, making it difficult to eat.

Similarly, a friend ordered the chicken wings, which are theoretically like San Tung's. Uh, I guess? They're sweet, and a tad spicy, but nowhere near ST. (Again, cheap Chinese, sure, authentic or similar to ST, no). The dish came with two measly pieces of raw broccoli which appeared more like decoration - if it should be decoration, at least make it edible. The broccoli was not cleaned nor had its leaves removed. Quite disgusting, to say the least.

Not to mention, the waiter forgot the soup. And the fortune cookie. And the spacing of our dishes was awful - I received my dish immediately after ordering, and fifteen minutes later, as I finished, my friend received his.

The service is sweet - the waiters are attentive, albeit a bit clumsy (I never received a menu and had to ask for one multiple times). However, good service doesn't make up for clumsy food. If ST closes, go next door - unless you truly are craving some really cheap Chinese eats. But don't compare it to San Tung.
author: Bobby W.

description: This is the first time that I ate lunch at this place. The dry fried chicken and the salmon chow fun are great dishes and the appetizer deep fried card Rangoon also good to try! I highly recommended this place and hopefully to visit again for lunch!
author: Minnie F.

description: This place was super fast delivery, I live close but it was still awesome. Good food too, I got the chow mein and spring rolls.
author: B G.

description: Chang's is my favorite takeout spot in SF! Was so stoked to find they deliver to my new neighborhood when I moved from the upper haight to the outer sunset. Deliveries always arrive earlier than anticipated and the drivers and staff are great. I once accidentally input my old delivery address, and even when I offered to come pickup, they delivered to me before the original estimated delivery time. AND the food was still hot and delicious! Top notch service AND the best Chinese food I've found here. 10/10! I lovvvvvvve the honey walnut prawns and the orange chicken. General Tso's is as good as they come and the orange chicken is even better. Also they have a huge fried rice selection that I've explored fully - all very good. Definitely spring for the rangoons!
author: Phylicia H.

description: We ate lunch here a few times prior and the last time the shrimp appeared undercooked and we had a reaction. This time the shrimp/beef was questionable again-choose not to eat it. Simply oily and bland/favorless dish dinner tonight- left a 1/3 of the dishes un-eaten and did not take a box...moving on.
author: Richard L.

description: Amazing lunch at Chang's Kitchen today!  We hand the Dry Fried Wings and General Tsao's Chicken which were both incredible.  Great spicy flavor and huge portions.  We had a great time with our waiter who was extremely friendly and accommodating. Highly recommended!!
author: Jim P.

description: So delicious! Might be the best I've had! Szechuan dinner for 2 with my fiance was amazing. Very fresh ingredients, not too greasy, and perfect spice. Staff was extremely friendly and prompt. Highly recommend the Mongolian beef. Definitely check this place out! It was worth the 12 minute walk from golden gate park
author: Masahiko W.

description: This place is amazing.  The service is great and the food spectacular.  Way better then San tung
author: Mariel J.

description: Delivery came 15 minutes earlier than the expected arrival time and fed our group of 6 for dinner (2 of whom were out-voted for our ultimate decision to go with Chinese). The Dry Fried Chicken was definitely the highlight that won everyone over. Everything was perfectly fine: Chow Mein, Mu Shu Pork, Orange Chicken, Broccoli Beef, Deep Fried Crab Rangoon. The only reason I wouldn't give this 5 stars is the competition is fierce for Chinese in the area and nothing really blew our minds. But for our relatively conventional order they gave us exactly what we expected.
author: Greg C.

description: Awesome Chinese food with big portions. Try the fried rice and spicy thin noodles. This is my go to for delivery.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
Thought this place was okay for the price and food. Ordered the lunch special fried rice with sesame chicken. It was pretty tasty but I found a good half and egg worth of egg shell. In my friend rice. How the hell did they happen? 

I would do a good double check before eating here. Food is pretty good, but they have their food quality check has to be better.
author: Enoch T.

description:
YUM! YUM! YUM!  This is our regular go to for delivery.  Great phone service, great portions, efficient delivery!  Great kung paos, mongolian, dim sum, mu shee.  You will not be disappointed.  This reaction was to the food we ordered from there last month.  

It is sad but the food we ordered tonight was the worse Chinese food I have ever had.  The lemon chicken was old brown and tough.  The kung pao chicken was flavorles and had an odd slimy texture.  The peanuts were stale.  People now days do not know how too make a good kung pao or a good mongolian any longe.  In the meantime I will never order from Chang's again.  If they cannot control their quality, then they do not desere to stay in business.  

It gives current cooks a bad name.
author: Emilia G.

description: My friend and I came here after seeing the crazy long line for San Tung and we definitely weren't disappointed! As is most Chinese food, it was rock solid (aka pretty damn tasty). We ordered the Kung Pao Chicken and Beef Chow Fun and it was good. I highly recommend the Beef Chow Fun!
author: Annette N.

description: Our family's fave Chinese restaurant. Best food! Our regular server Lou is very nice and funny and the owner is nice too. Great lunch specials.
author: Gigi C.

description:
Skip the wait across the street, why wait when they're all the same food? 
Four of us ordered crab rangoon, pork fried rice, dry fried chicken wings, boychoy with garlic sauce, and a variety of dim sum. Food was not too oily or salty which is a must for me when I go to Chinese restaurants. 
Food came out quick and service was great, would definitely come back or even get them delivered to me!
author: Sean W.

description:
This is my favorite Chinese restaurant of all time.  We have been to San Francisco four times, and have made time to come eat here every time. 

We always order the General Tso's Chicken, which is garlicky and crispy, and the best!  

We also love the Mongolian Chicken.  Love the onions and heat from the chicken.  Delicious!

The food comes very quickly and service is friendly.  

If I had to choose something to nitpick about, it would be that you have to order rice - it doesn't come with.  

Other than that, this is a must eat every time!
author: S.Y. K.

description: Food was great. Wasn't super salty like some other places. Also was very pleased with the service that I received.
author: Yi M.

description: The food was very tasty and the best I have had in a while.  We had the food delivered and the wait time was reasonable.  I will order again from this restaurant.
author: Ramona M.

description: Wanted chicken wings and San Tung is closed? Well, you're in luck because this place has similar chicken wings and taste as good + no line! HOLLA! My friends and I wanted to go to San Tung one day but unfortunately they close on Wednesday's....bummer but anyways, I've been to Chang's before and they are as good as San Tung. The waiters are actually much nicer since they actually check up on you to see if you're enjoying your meal which is definitely a plus for me. It was a party of three for us and we ordered bunch of different foods. We had the salted fish fried rice, chow mein, chicken wings, and some veggies. All very good and tasty. Salted fish and the chicken wings are my favorite. Salted fish fried rice is a bit salty but the rice balances it out. The chicken wings were hot and spicy but very flavorful. I'm not sure why people are giving it bad ratings but honestly, I had a good experience and I'll definitely be back again soon!
author: Monica W.

description: I received junk mail from this establishment. It is a saturation mailing, addressed to "Local Postal Customer" with no address. It is impossible to opt out of this kind of mailing. It is incredibly wasteful of the earth's resources, and does not even offer an option to stop receiving it. I will not be going to this restaurant, because they conduct this amoral business practice.
author: Angela D.

description:
Came here when the place across the street was too full. Family was in town so we sat down and immediately started ordering food. 

The owners are very friendly and funny! They played a couple of jokes on us and even sang my husband happy birthday  when he walked in late. He was so confused it was funny. 

The food is good and the portions are hearty. 

Check it out!! 

We got the fried rice, noodles, soup, and potstickers!
author: Carina M.

description:
Gets the job done Chinese take out. Don't know why everyone says that. If it got the job done I'd go to some cheap hole in the wall place on Clement. 

Changs! Their set dinner prices and crazy fast delivery makes this place my go to Chinese take out every single time.

Everything comes hot still.

The right order every time.

Friendly service.

Affordable price.

Literally waiting for my order right now
author: Ninotchka A.

description: I just ordered food for the first time with Yelp. I am visiting my girlfriend in town and she tasked me with ordering dinner. We picked Chang's. Realizing that I did not have any cash, I ordered online using my cc. I did not select sn option for tip and the delivery guy comes over and the first thing he asks for is the tip. He hands me my food. I explain to him that it was my first time and he is insistent on a tip. He starts saying that I selected a "cash tip." He keeps asking and he finally asks one more time for a tip and I again tell him that I don't have any cash. I say that there is no way to tip with that attitude at all. He walks away! As someone in the service industry, I need to make people aware that if you hire someone like this, your business will suffer,  regardless of the food. We haven't even eaten yet! Poor delivery service with a terrible representation of this place. Hopefully, the service in the restaurant is much better than the delivery! Terrible!!!
author: J W.

description: I've come here for dim sum and it was tasty. My favorite part about this place, though, is the owner. He has a great sense of humor and always makes me smile --honestly why I keep coming back!
author: Em S.

description:
The Mango Chicken is seriously the best item on the menu and I hope that it moves from being a lunch item to being on the full menu.  The Beef Cilantro is also amazing.  So far, the only Chinese restaurant that I think gives Chang's a run for its money in San Francisco is Henry's Hunan.  

This place is amazing!!!!!!
author: Brikka M.

description: I ordered delivery through Eat24 and I will be doing it again soon! I had meatless chicken mu shu and meatless chicken kung pao with brown rice. Both entrees were fresh and tasty with plenty left over for dinner again tomorrow night. I chose the spicy option for the kung pao (options were mild, medium, spicy & very spicy) and it had a nice kick without being  overly spicy. The veggies were all fresh & crunchy. As a vegetarian, I appreciate the meatless options. I also greatly appreciate the restaurant's decent health score, the highest score of comparable places. Delivery was fast and smooth as well.
author: Marybeth S.

description: Fast delivery and generous portions for the price. This place in my go to chinese delivery. Easy to order online via yelp and pretty quick delivery, around 30mins on a friday night at dinner time. Ordered Mongolian beef which was good on flavor and a good amount of heat to it. The veggies were crisp and fresh and not too soggy. Also got the combination chow fun, noodles were well cooked, a little disappointed in the amount of protein as it had an ok amount of chicken and beef but like only 2 little pieces of shrimp. Overall the food was good to delivery and it was fast
author: Peter P.

description: Appetizers were overly salted. The cook that night over seasoned half the food we ordered.
author: Pang M.

description: Hands down my favorite general tso chicken and walnut prawns and reasonably priced.  The service is great too!  Love to see people there supporting it
author: Patarck S.

description: I ordered online through their website and received a confirmation email.  An hour and a half later, my food still hadn't come, and I called the restaurant to check on where it was.  I gave them my address and they said my food had already left the restaurant and was on its way.  Another half hour went by, no food.  I called again and they gave me a long story about how they never got the order and that it must have been my fault, even though I booked through their website and not a third party, got a confirmation email, and called and got confirmation that the food was coming to my address twenty minutes prior.  Don't waste your time.
author: Juliana D.

description: Had delivery. Mongolian beef was great, just the right amount of spicy, and just the right amount of onions. 4 stars because the chow main was a bit bland in taste.
author: Fernando G.

description: Let's get to the point, the staff (guy running the show) is amazing and friendly. Fast and nice service. Food is really good but I feel like when they are busy, it can get hectic and warm food comes out. Loved the hot & sour soup. Ordered the chowmain and it was a little dry but very tasty! Order seafood it's good.
author: esme R.

description:
3.5

Quick delivery easily and seamlessly done via Yelp. Prices are very reasonable...something like 6 dishes, which were very generous, for about 58 bucks with tip.

Food?? Meh. It is okay but I wasnt blown away. Stuff was pretty oily...but the spicy stuff definitely was spicy. Great pork fried rice Like someone else mentioned.

I am still a ton kiang groupie...even though it is twice the price.
author: David G.

description: the spicy dry fried chicken wings and the appetizer deep fried crab Rangoon are must ordered. They are just so great. I will definitely come back again for those two dishes.
author: KaiChiu F.

description:
Great value, never a line, and good variety! I used to queue up at ST across the street, but no more. C's deep fried chicken wings are just as good and I like their vegetables. 

Their staff is always courteous and kind. It's my go to spot for Chinese food in the Inner Sunset. I order the sesame chicken, deep fried chicken wings, and dumplings.

To Jan Carlo below, if you've got a large party, a baked in tip is usually standard. It's not just the tip fee charge, there is the SF Restaurant Health Care surcharge of 4% plus the 9.5% Sales tax and then the 15% - 18% tip. Are you really complaining about a $53 total bill when you had a party of 6 or more? Are you serious? Blame the government if you need to blame somebody for all your taxes.

I hope you didn't spend too much on your law degree. Because I'd ask for a refund if you're willing to pay tens of thousands of dollars in law school tuition a year and yet complain about a 15% tip that equals $12? How are you going to win any cases when you can't understand the other side? If you want to save money, eat out less often or eat less. 

Learn some EMPATHY. The waiters and owner don't speak the best English, so they probably had a hard time conveying the rules. They work hard every day earning near min wages to please customers like you who couldn't give a damn. Be kind to others, and others will be kind to you.
author: Jacob J.

description: The food is good, but I feel like we always have a missing item- this time it was an order of white rice.
author: Ashley H.

description: They mostly get overflow from San Tung, but Chang's is worth a try on its own. Good dim sum, free crab ragoon with delivery minimum, and friendly service if you eat there.
author: Dawn C.

description:
If you always go to San tung you should try Chang's instead. Their dry fried wings are BANGIN    PERIOD. 

Hi Michelle
author: Lawrence L.

description: We didn't want to wait to be seated so we picked this place and I'm glad we did. Our waiter was so funny, he kept messing with us the whole time saying things like "We're out of rice." (They weren't.) We definitely ordered too much food but it was all great from the fried rice, to the sweet and sour shrimp and of course the chicken wings. We also ordered shrimp potstickers and had to take mostly everything home. Have yet to try San Tung but can say that if you don't want to wait in line or they're out of chicken wings like the last time I went, this place is a great alternative. Parking is pretty hard to find in this area, especially on a Friday night
author: Trisha S.

description:
Chang's Kitchen saved my life.

At least it felt that way. Wife and daughter had been out of town for about a week. I had been suffering the worst flu of my life and did not want to leave the house or prepare anything for myself. More of a lay around in a fetal position kind of mood. After a few days of not eating soup seemed like something that I could work with and I found Chang's online. Corn soup, wonton soup, and ma po tofu were ordered online and 30 minutes later a smiling Chinese man was at my door with hot food. The food was so hot I burned my mouth on the corn soup. Didn't bother to check thinking it would be lukewarm...

I ate dinner from Changs and am still alive. Thank you Chang's Kitchen.

Subsequently we have ordered lazy homey style takeout Chinese from Changs and been happy with the result each time. It is not going to hit you over the head with authenticity or local, organic, free range, etc. but it gets the job done.
author: Easwud C.

description:
Absolutely love Chang's; my favorite place to get Chinese food! I'm Chinese, so I eat Chinese food almost every day, but I'll never get tired of coming to here!
My boyfriend and I randomly decided to try this place even though it was relatively empty (it's easy to be overlooked when San Tung is across the street), and we definitely didn't regret it! We've tried their dry fried chicken wings, which were generous in quantity and overflowing with flavor, their tomato beef noodles, spicy wontons, garlic eggplant, Mongolian beef, etc (we try something new each and every time and nothing has let us down so far)! The food gets a 5/5 for both portion size and flavor! 
This place also earned a solid five star review from me because their service has been impeccable each and every time! I once came here after a colonoscopy, but kept fading in and out of consciousness due to the procedure's anesthesia. Good thing I was with someone else, but I clearly remember how kind and considerate the waiters were! 
I feel a bit sad when I see this place on the emptier side and San Tung with an overflowing line! I hope this place gets the recognition it deserves!
author: S Z.

description: Slow service, requested white meat chicken and was given dark, never got our complete order, and while eating, they rolled a garbage can through the dining room. That's disgusting! We will never eat here again!
author: Antonio L.

description:
Ordered delivery twice, the first time they screwed up my order, I ordered broccoli and beef, but they gave me beefstew with eggplant with the broccoli. I hate egg plant. I'm allergic to it. Gave it to my coworker the next day. 

The wings were good, but the second time I ordered it wasn't that dericious.
author: Pickle R.

description: The food was amazing! The sautéed string beans with minced pork, Singapore style rice noodle, and the salt and pepper pork chop was amazing. The food was in large portions, and amazing prices.
author: Michelle B.

description:
The food was strangely sweet for everything on the menu. I didn't like that, as it seemed like they only knew how to flavor in that one way.
If you like food that it sweeter, you may like this place though!
Also, the fried chicken was good. Again sweeter than San Tung, but worth it if you don't want to wait the long lines.
author: Lina H.

description: Quick, friendly delivery. Food was hot and fresh, portions are large and satisfying. Found my new go to delivery.
author: Vito F.

description: I am usually open to trying new places, the reviews on this place were okay and it was open so we decided to try. The man helping us was so friendly and patient. We ordered the lunch special and they brought us this funny smelling soup. It was too salty. The main course was alright. Nothing special. The textures of the meat were a little off and it wasn't well seasoned. I even ordered dim sum sample plate, again, no seasoning and the meat texture was off. Dumplings we're sweet though
author: Dalia R.

description: I am a true fan of this place as an all around good place of good Chinese food at a reasonable price.  A big plus is that they deliver in a wide radius of the restaurant too!  They are located in the Upper Sunset and I am in Twin Peaks and they still deliver for free - awesome!  My go to's are Mongolian Beef - medium spice, Sweet and Sour Chicken, Wor Won Ton Soup, Chinese Broccoli in sauted garlic and they give you fried rice with egg for free; all for about $40.  Not too bad in my book.   Have tried other places in the city but always come back to Changs.
author: Mike K.

description:
Good comfort Asian food. Very flavorful but maybe a tad too much...

FOOD: I came here for a group meeting and we ordered and shared a bunch of dishes, some includes string beans, coconut shrimp, fried rice, chow mien, fried chicken wings...Very traditional food you would find in any "Chinese" restaurant. Why the quotation marks? Because to be honest you would never find any of these dishes in a real Chinese restaurant, because they have been customized to suit the American taste buds. Everything tasted good, but the flavor is too overwhelming for me - either too sweet, or too salty. I felt really thirsty that night, probably because all of the sodium (and MSG ??)...

SETTING: Very typical Chinese restaurant - family-style. And it's right across from its fried chicken rival - Sun Tung! Both fried chicken tasted good to me. 

SERVICE: Very friendly servers and the dishes came out very quickly. 

PRICE: The food was covered but I think the price is within the typical price range ($10-15/dish). The portion sizes are also pretty big - definitely enough for 2 meals if you are eating alone! 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Pretty good comfort food but ONLY ONCE IN A WHILE!! I have higher standards for Chinese food since I am Chinese and was born in Southern China, so I really prefer aromatic dishes with light seasoning. Food like this is a little too greasy and heavy for me..
author: Wendy F.

description:
This place has awesome dry fried wings. I've come here twice when the lines at San Tung were too long. The wings at Chang's are just as good without the line. 

Have also gotten the spicy eggplant and the black bean halibut fillet. Everything came out piping hot and delicious. Highly recommend!
author: Teresa L.

description: I have to say the two top thump's up for Chang's is their preparation of veggies; either with or w/ot meat, so tasty. And then their portion size. Humongous! Student's everywhere could eat for a week for under 30 bucks.However, the sweet and sour isn't too hot (and I don't mean the temp) and the dishes are a bit bland. However, their chicken is great. You just have to go through their menu to see what you like. Honesty, they're 3 and 3/4 stars; but totally worth trying!
author: Alex H.

description:
My go to Chinese take-out spot!

The ginger sauces are killer, especially the one that comes with my favorite item, the spicy wonton.

The spicy wonton is this little pillow of soft dough swaddling a hearty bite of pork stuffing. All soaking in a spicy, gingery, crack laced, fish sauce that is so good. I srsly save every drop of it and use it when I cook. 

For reals, that sauce can take my lame fried rice recipe and puts it right up there on par with Gary Skanko. OK well maybe a little under par, sans the fancy shmancy presentations, but yeah spicy wontons for life!

Thx Chang.
author: R J.

description:
Gerenal Tso's chicken is my favorite dish in this restaurant, its juicy and spicy, and the spicy it's just perfect. And I come for lunch a lot, lunch plate it's big enough also get soup with it. The service was very nice. 
That's why I come back all the time!
author: Huixin C.

description: This place is delicious. The service was fast and extremely helpful. The place looked clean and the food was great. I got the Mongolian beef and the honey walnut shirt along with their dry fried chicken wing. It was a excellent meal.
author: Tony N.

description: Chang's is a typical small Chinese place in the Inner Sunset.  We were there for lunch and both of us had chow fun.  Mine was dry beef and my wife's was wet seafood.  Both had excellent wok flavor.  Serving portions were huge.  The only downside was there must have been high levels of MSG because both of us had very dry mouths later in the afternoon.
author: Steve N.

description:
Came here to celebrate Mid Autumn Festival with family for dinner. It was oddly empty... Anyways, the food was pretty average. They don't give you chopsticks by default, so that was a sign it's not as authentic Chinese food, at least in my opinion. The tofu was pretty dry and didn't taste that good. I don't know what the heck was with the Gai Lan (Chinese Broccoli) but it was super fiber-y. 

The General's Chicken was pretty good though. And service was very friendly. I'd give it three stars. Average Chinese place, probably wouldn't come again though.
author: Brandon L.

description: Stumbled upon this place since I couldn't get a seat at San Tung across the street EVER. To my surprise, extremely please with the service cleanliness and most of all delicious large size portions at a great value. Love coming here when given the chance. Shanghai Soup Dumplings are a all time fave!
author: Eduardo S.

description:
WARNING: For those who are eating here, make sure to calculate your bill before paying up. They add mandatory tips in your bill. We had a bill of $53. We added everything with tax and it came out $41. So they added $12 as tip. When we asked for breakdown, they said that the tips are already included and it's in the law of San Francisco to give tips (Excuse me, you ain't fooling no one who studied law).

Food is great but service is soooo bad. It took a while before we got our food. The waiter even kept ignoring us when we call them.
author: Jan Carlo G.

description:
Great delivery Chinese food! Order came fast, hot, and well-contained

Soup dumplings - stellar. How do they keep the soup in there during transport?! I usually lose half my liquid getting the dumpling from the plate to my face. 

General Tso's Chicken - A whole lot on NOM. You could smelly the spiciness when the lid was lifted off

Stir fried rice cakes with pork - always a winner

Combination appetizer with pork bun and shrimp dumpling- definitely worth it
author: Jordan F.

description: On different occasions I have tried (delivery, not dine-in) their Mongolian beef/lamb, shrimp dumplings, orange chicken, General tsao's (spelling?) chicken, veggie shrimps, plain rice, fried rice, and Mongolian beef chow mein. They are one of the best restaurants my family has tried in San Francisco; costumers can depend on the meats being fresh and lean cuts, the veggies being fresh and not being used as fillers, and the portion sizes being VERY generous. Be warned, however, that the sodium content of the Mongolian beef/lamb dishes may be high on occasion, and that the chow main has a strong peanut-oil smell, but besides that, this restaurant is fantastic.
author: Jenifer J.

description: We come here often and they always give us great service! The fried chicken is definitely worth a try, it comes out hot and fresh! I also like the salmon with the tofu as well as the egg tofu with beef and veggies. I think all dishes are great and worth trying new things every time I come :)
author: Kotoko T.

description:
What happens when your friends of friends from out of town visit SF?
They decide to get San Tung at peak lunchtime on a weekend.
(Which all Inner Sunset locals know is a laughable idea)

Of course, it is crowded beyond imagination, so of course, they decide to go across the street to Chang's Kitchen and order fried chicken wings.

My problems:
- The storefront says it's Asian Fusion, but the only fusion parts I noticed were the fried chicken wings and the forks
- Don't expect dry fried chicken wings to be like San Tung's... these are really dry fried like KFC dehydration status
- Small portions (however this assessment is confounded because we all came here after running a 10k)

My approvals:
- Overall, their Chinese food is better than Panda Express
- It's the kind of friendly mama-san, rather than disgruntled servers that make people complain about service on Yelp
author: Edna C.

description: Ordered the veggie friend rice, veggie chow mein, and the sesame chicken. Delivery arrived hot and fast. The portions were good with plenty of fresh veggies.  I'm picky about meat and the sesame chicken was great. I would say it's the best Chinese food I've had in a long time.
author: Amanda A.

description: One of my goto place for fast delivery. Food taste good. Price is reasonable. Portion size is large. My favorites are General Tso's Chicken, BBQ Pork Egg Fu Young, Chinese Broccoli Beef.
author: Robert S.

description:
I can't believe I hadn't heard of Chang's Kitchen until my brother decided to Yelp an alternative to San Tung's. The food here is great! Some of the dishes are cooked a little differently from other Chinese places I've been to, but the quality and taste was not a sacrifice. Everything tasted very fresh. Their chicken wings are comparable to San Tung's across the street. It's cooked and flavored a little differently, but still good! The only little gripe I had was that the breading on the Honey Walnut Prawns was pretty thick. But the flavor was on spot. 

Service here is amazing. All of the staff was super attentive, friendly, and professional. They were on top of all our needs - extra napkins, refills on water and tea, clearing the table, etc. 

Personally, I don't like dealing with the dinner rush parking in this area so it was great to see them constantly receiving delivery orders. The phone was pretty much ringing non-stop the whole time we were there. It wasn't annoying (not to me); it was just a little surprising given how empty the restaurant was when we entered. So don't let the emptiness of the restaurant fool you! Give Chang's Kitchen a try.
author: Florence S.

description: The owners are so nice. I really enjoyed my salmon lunch special. It was crispy, spicy, and delicious. The prices are almost criminally cheap.
author: Lauren U.

description: Everything was great with delivery. Hot, fast, & fresh. The Sesame Chicken was so good and by far the best dish of everything we got. Just an overall good order for a Friday night movie!
author: Chris T.

description:
If you dare to open a Chinese restaurant right across the street from one of the most popular Chinese restaurants in SF, you better be good   Chang's Kitchen didn't let me down.   
No need to wait for a table. Service is super prompt, courteous, and friendly.  The food selection is almost identical to the one across the street.  We ordered dry fried chicken wings, curry prawns, garlic filet mione and shrimp fried rice.  I also had specific request to each order and the food all came exactly the way I wanted.   The taste of food is GREAT!  This place is no joke!   
I just don't see any reason for me to join the hype across the street.
author: W C.

description:
I've only ever ordered for delivery from here and they've never disappointed. I ALWAYS get the meatless sesame chicken with a side of brown rice. It has the best sauce ever. They offer a wide array of meatless options if you're vegan which is great. My husband likes the kung pao meatless chicken.

The fried tofu is also really yummy and you get A LOT for your money.
author: Adelaide M.

description: Are you sick of the line at San Tung? Go to Chang's, which is the forgotten but severely underrated little Chinese brother. The fried chicken is just as good here and there is less of a crowd. Staff is friendlier as a result.
author: Jin N.

description: We have been going to Chang's Kitchen since my daughter was a little girl...so for 20 years plus.  The staff is very friendly, it is very clean, and the food is very good.  They have dry fried chicken, war wonton and many other popular dishes....if you want something, ask because they will accommodate you. Really a little gem!
author: L G.

description:
I was feeling adventurous last night and decided to order take out from Chang's thru yelp. Never tried or heard of them before which is risky for take out because if somethings not right with your order you're kinda just ...stuck. 

First off the food (and portions!) were awesome!!! I was super impressed by the way they wrapped each dish individually. Major props for that and thanks for the small details. I had the eggplant with spicy garlic sauce. And that thing was saucy! If it wasn't wrapped in its own bag it would have been an annoying mess. I most other chinese restaurants clearly don't give a shit. So again, thanks. I also had the mix mushrooms and tofu and veggie chow mein. 

Everything was great, will recommend and order again :) OH! and they deliver fast! My order took about 30mins.
author: Ashley Y.

description: Great food. I work in the area two days a week. They know me by name. Szechuen Salmon on lunch menu. Great.... had dinner there too. Nice tv screen. Watched the Warriors.... great service, always with a smile. Walnut prawns yummy, kung pao shrimp and chicken. Great. I'm hooked on the salmon right now. Check them out. Daily lunch specials, decent prices. You'll be glad you went there. Enjoy!
author: Karen L.

description: Owner was nice but OMG I DON'T THINK THEY WASH THE DISHES. I saw lipstick stain on one of the bowls that the waiter brought to my table. Food tasted like they were precooked and microwaved. They got cold after couple mins. Bug in our water and cups were dirty.
author: Thanh L.

description:
We were so impressed with this place! We live about half a block from it but hadn't eaten here before until a few days ago, on Christmas Eve when most stuff was closed. The spot used to be Golden Rice Bowl, which was very "just-OK," so when it opened under a new name, I wasn't sure if it was the same place with a new name or if it was a new place. Judging by the menu and the food, I would say that either it's new ownership or at least new management. They were packed that night and we had to wait a bit for our takeout order, but the food was really good. 

We had the dry fried chicken wings--they were awesome, though we ordered medium and I would have liked them a bit spicier, so next time I will order spicy instead. However the other food we ordered medium was pretty spicy (the sauteed string beans and Mongolian beef). The string beans were some of the best I've had--sometimes those can be kind of soggy, but the string beans were still a little crunchy, nice and spicy, great flavor and texture. The beef was really good too. We also got the pork fried rice, which is also some of the best fried rice I've had--not greasy at all like fried rice sometimes is. The crab rangoon were OK, but probably the least exciting of the dishes (though crab rangoon is kind of always exciting anyway). 

We'll definitely go back now. If you are waiting across the street at San Tung and feel like getting some delicious Chinese food without waiting 2 hours for it, I recommend crossing the street and checking this spot out. You won't be disappointed.
author: Jennie S.

description:
Decent Chinese food on a cold day. Small place on a busy street. Pretty big menu. Food came our really fast and fresh. Lots of people coming in to grab to-to orders. 
Very nice owner and staff. Go out of their way to help you and they have good relationships from their regulars it seemed. 
Day after food heated up was just as good!
author: Loren L.

description:
As noted by many yelpers, very nice owner.

Portions are Hugh, so order with care or you will taking more home than you consume on site.

I should have ordered the chicken wings.  They looked so good.  Next time!
author: Bradley C.

description: Food was fresh, veggies crisp, very flavorful, and delivered pretty quick for a Friday nite.  Recommended!
author: V S.

description: This place is like bad Americanized chinese food. Once you go in, you get seated and there's already forks on the table. That should be red flag number one. Instead, we got a menu and we got General Tso's chicken, chow fun, and the dry fried chicken wings. The chow fun was by far the best thing there and the General Tso and chicken wings were both not good. The General Tso's chicken was mostly breading with no chicken whatsoever. The chicken wings were too sweet and breaded as well. Lets just say... you should just endure the wait across the street at San Tung and enjoy the best wings in the city......
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Got discouraged waiting forever for San Tung and decided to take a chance on this place.

Probably 4 stars overall but starvation mode made everything about 1 star tastier.  Also one of my best friends is named Chang so bonus points for that too.

Hopefully this will spread some of the culinary love across the street and decrease some of the absurd wait times.
author: Gerald D.

description: First time visitor. Awesome customer service. I requested a custom plate and the server didn't have any problem placing the order. The portions were large. Definitely will be back to this restaurant if I'm ever in town.
author: Juan M.

description: I would give this restaurant 0 stars if I could. I placed an online order and after an hour of waiting and no delivery in sight, I contacted the restaurant and Yelp. I was told the order was on its way. After 1.5 hours, the restaurant called and said "the boss says we are not going to deliver to you.  You live too far away."  I explained that I live about 2-3 miles from the restaurant and my order was processed and that it was 1.5 hours after I originally placed the order.  The guys just said "sorry".  My dinner with my guests were ruined.  I will never order from this restaurant again for its lack of professionalism and courtesy to its customers.
author: Patrick L.

description: Good food, quick delivery. Did have a few problems with the on-line ordering with Yelp, but other than that - all good...
author: Simon W.

description: Stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner with my siblings and many other of the restaurants were closed but this one was open. Decided to try it out, it was a great choice, the place is super clean, the staff friendly, food quick, reasonable and delicious. Will be back for sure!!
author: Alicia P.

description:
I actually like this place better than San Tung! San Tung's dried fried chicken has better taste, whereas this place's is sweeter, but Chang's Kitchen's entrees are way better! We tried the walnut prawn, fried rice, sautéed green beans, dried fried chicken, Mongolian beef, and Kung pao chicken!! Everything was so good ;D 

Their service is awesome too, well at least from the older man. He was so funny and cheerful and made so many jokes:)
author: Jacquelyn W.

description: We recently ate here twice, both times the food was just OK. We got delivery and the food was made quickly and delivered on time. Veggie chow fun, ok, lacking in vegetables. My husband had two different vegetable beefs dishes - they had too much garlic, beef was just okay. Had a craving for sweet-and-sour chicken. It was OK. I asked for no Bellpepper peppers but they put them in anyway. I'm allergic, my husband ate most of it... OK overall but not my first choice.
author: Coco J.

description: We had ordered online through their website the following dishes - spinach tofu mushroom soup, spicy garlic fried rice with mushroom, General Tsao's Meatless Chicken. A promotion was going on so got Egg rolls (3) for free. The fried rice was really good. Egg rolls weren't greasy and tasted okay. The soup was a clear one with mild seasoning so just what we had wanted. General Tsao's meatless chicken but it didn't meet our expectations. Delivery was prompt.
author: P B.

description: Sooo good. Love the meatless options. We always get general tso's meatless chicken. It is crispy and spicy and full of flavor. Chewy texture which vegetarians often miss out on. Also vegetarian potstickers and buns. Yum!
author: Marie E.

description: The sweet and sour chicken was so deep fried that it didn't even taste like chicken. Other than that, not great food. I would probably order from somewhere else next time.
author: Kray P.

description: FRUSTRATING. We ordered delivery. The service was friendly, the food was just so-so. But they forgot to include our potstickers. No big deal -- these things happen. But that was the main dish for one of our eaters. So we called within minutes to see if he could come back. Hopefully the bag was just left in the car. Even if not, we're only about a mile from the restaurant. On the phone, they promised to bring us the potstickers right away. Two hours later we gave up -- and ate a late-night salami sandwich instead of potstickers.
author: Patrick J.

description: Wow!! We ordered delivery of tofu, orange meatless chicken, Singapore noodles and fry rice... The food was absolutely delicious!! And for delivery when we received the food it was still hot!!! Definitely would recommend this place :)
author: Ria D.

description:
I'll say it... I like Chang's Kitchen BETTER than San Tung! The service is great, the food tastes fresher, and you never have to wait. Better yet, they deliver when you don't feel like leaving the house. I've often been there when it wasn't busy but I don't count that against them - I think they do a ton (if not a majority) of their business in to-go and takeout orders. I'd rather not wait anyway! 

We get super basic orders usually; some kind of chicken (Sesame or Dry Fried) and recently got the chow mein (SO SPICY but SO GOOD). The soup portions are huge (even a small is enough for 2-3 people). Love this place.
author: Whitney D.

description:
My most favorite Chinese food in SF!! Wandered in here after San Tung across the street had an annoyingly long wait & we were hungered. Was amazed and excited to find everything I have ordered from that day & since is delish!! BBQ Pork Fried, THE BEST Shanghai Soup Dumplings!! , Mongolian Triple Combo, Sautéed Spicy String Beans with/without Pork, Eggplant w Garlic... All amazing. 

Lastly and most importantly, the server/host is the cutest and most hilarious Asian restaurant owner I have ever met. Once asked him to split the check & asked if we needed scissors, haha
author: Sabrina P.

description:
Went to a late lunch today around 3:40 PM and missed lunch specials):. But none the less the food was HELLA good!!! Best Chinese food I've had at a sit down Chinese place ever. Everything is made to order and it didn't take hella long to make about a 3-4 minute time gap for each order to come. We ordered the house fried rice, house chowmein, sweet and sour chicken and chicken wings(minus the spicey) and all of them WAS HELLLAAAA GOOOD. I cannot emphasize enough how good the food was. 

SERVICE was a ten!! The woman and man that served us were very kind and helpful with questions. The man was HELLA funny and made the experience more enjoyable. Asked for a refill of water and he said "noooooo... PROBLEM" and just the way he said it put a smile on my face.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
3.75/5; worth a try but could be improved

Like other reviewers said, I was equally apprehensive when entering a restaurant across from the (in)famous San Tung, but I was pleasantly surprised! If you crave a quiet environment where you can actually hear the people you're speaking with, fast and friendly service, fresh food, and the bonus of a television, come on over to Chang's.

The lunch special runs until 3pm (fairly late--most end at 2pm) and comes with rice, soup (hot & sour) and an egg roll. The soup is not too spicy and the egg roll lacks the artificial red sweet and sour sauce other places douse their egg rolls in: you can taste the freshness and crispiness. The portion of the lunch special entree is smaller than other places though, so a balance adjustment in the ratio of rice:entree would be good.

Yes, the bathrooms are very clean and spacious. Yes, the waiters speak proficient English. Yes, you can hang out a while and catch up with friends. Yes, I will go back!
author: Brittany L.

description: Ordered for delivery through UberEats. Fast and reliable. The food was good and we enjoyed as expected.
author: William H.

description: First time ordering and they were super fast! Placed my order at 2:24 pm to have it delivered at 4:30pm but it arrived at 2:40pm! I wanted it delivered later tonight but hey not complaining for less than 20 minutes! Food is very good too and big portions!
author: Dayna Y.

description:
To be completely honest, we were trying to go to Sang Tung and when we realized there were twenty people ahead of us, we decided to go here. 

We had a party of five and were seated immediately since the restaurant was empty. We were a bit apprehensive since no one else was there but we decided to stick with it as we were pretty hungry. 

Our server was wonderful. As we ordered he made jokes and was generally very welcoming and pleasant. 

Here is what we ordered:

Garlic Fried Rice - So so good! Some of the best fried rice I've had. Very flavorful. 

Walnut Prawns - Very good. Well fried and full of flavor. 

Chicken Chow Mien - Solid. Cooked well, the noodles were a great texture and the flavor was there. 

Dry Fried Chicken Wings - Yum. Hot and fresh crunchy with the right amount of sauce. 

Garlic Pork - Others liked this, but for me it was a bit too sweet. 

Soup Dumplings - I've had better ones elsewhere, but these weren't bad. 

All of the food came pretty quickly. In typical Chinese restaurant fashion they brought out each dish as it was ready, which means it is fresher, but you don't get everything right away. It wasn't too long from first dish to last, though. 

Overall this place is a solid choice, especially if you don't want to wait forever. I would eat here again.
author: Chris B.

description:
Girlfriend and I came to the city for a hiking trip and were craving Chinese food. Place was smaller than I thought but it feels homely inside. 

We had a very warm welcome by more than one of the employees there and were taken care of right away. The place is pretty clean and the menus are easy to read. We only had to wait ~10 minutes for our food and it was a pleasure. 

Very welcoming atmosphere, pretty clean establishment, and a very friendly team of employees. Would highly recommend and come back if I decide to come through the city again!
author: Michael G.

description:
After receiving my order I was promptly asked "where's my tip?" To which I replied I left it on the card. Or so I thought, I did sign the driver a tip because apparently it didn't process it in. My bad. Either way I was aggravated that this entitled lil brat approached it in the manner he did. Also, as I had company over and was at my new place and not properly unpacked I asked for condiments I.e. A couple forks or chopsticks in the least. Nope. 

On further review I found onions in my fried rice (after I requested no vegetables in it) as I am allergic to these I was unable to eat this too. (Which kinda sucks because the reviews for the bbq fried rice were pretty high. 

Thanks chang's kitchen, now I'm headed to Safeway for forks and a precook ex dinner for myself!
author: Cody N.

description: Was aiming to go to San Tungs directly across the street but we were TOO HUNGRY to wait in that line. We sat right away, had plenty of space for dining, not too noisy, INCREDIBLY FAST SERVICE. Plus the food was delicious.. Wings, lo mein, general tso chicken... Yum yum yum! Nice portion sizes. Will be enjoying again for lunch :)
author: Lauren K.

description: Garlic Filet Mignon cooked to perfection, as was my wife's kung pao chicken and the service was great!
author: Brian M.

description:
Very rude service and we won't be going back, although these folks didn't seem to care.

We had 6 people. When ordering a soup, we asked the server if the soup was large enough for our party, she said the amount was good for 4 people only and that we should order 2. We decided to order 1 soup and a noodle dish instead (in addition to a few other entrees) to have more variety.

When the soup came, the server started serving the big bowl of soup and filled 4 bowls up to the rim and left 2 bowls completely empty. We, kids and adults at the table, opened our eyes wide and could not believe what we saw. When she was done, we had to take over the ladle and redistribute our soup to fill the 2 empty bowls. The server was obviously making a statement that only 4 of us should enjoy the soup because we did not order 2 identical soups as she wanted. 

At one point during our meal, we asked another server who walked by to take a picture of us. She immediately raised her hands signaling they're dirty (without saying a word) and gave us an annoyed look that we're asking for too much while she was busy around. We resorted to taking a selfie.

1 star is too much for how we were treated as customers.
author: Linda A.

description: Best food best service why wait in line for San Tung it's over hyped and not much better
author: Nui J.

description: This place was a giant let down! Never again. Got delivery from here bc it had similar reviews as Nan King Road. I don't understand how bc the food was very poor quality. We got the diced dry chicken and i ended up throwing it all away. Nothing but batter and minuscule pieces of fatty chicken. Way too much sauce what a soggy mess, ain't nothing dry about this greasy pile. So gross. Also got the combo fried rice, chicken chow fun, and Singapore noodles which were all so so... definitely a lot of throw away pieces of meat mixed in. Nope, do not want. Bye now.
author: David S.

description: This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in town serving the best chicken wings. Whenever I need some delicious Asian food, this place is a go to.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Don't sleep on chang's! Their dry fried chicken wings are the bomb! Better than San tung. Michewwe.
author: Nelson L.

description: Chang"s kitchen the food is good for us, we order the online food online, the driver delivery very fast, fresh  and he is very friendly so good that I gave some to my neighbor highly recommended I will go back again
author: Zhi L.

description:
San Tung was closed when we got there around 3 so, my girlfriend and I opted for Chang's Kitchen across the street. A quick yelp review to see the overall ratings and it's a lock. We came in and were seated right away. The room was half full, which is a good sign. We quickly ordered:

1. Minced pork with string beans- This was fresh and crispy. It was wonderfully seasoned, not too salty or bland.
2. Mapo tofu with pork- This was amazing over rice.
3. Walnut prawns- I remembered it being amazing but couldn't confirm with a second piece because my girlfriend were throwing them back like miss pacman. It was crispy and delicious.
4. Dry fried chicken wings- Three layer texture of awesomeness. (Juicy/savory meat inside, crispy goodness in the middle, and sweet sweet sticky glaze on the outside)

This place had a lot of nice touches that separated itself from the pack. For one, it was incredibly clean. The menu's weren't sticky from food residue like other places. Also, the owner was a sweet lady that put my leftover food in the box for me even when i insisted to do it on my own. What else can I say?.. The lady has class.
author: Vu T.

description: Happen to b in the Inner Richmond & craving dumplings. Stumbled on this spot & checked it out. Clean, easy, friendly staff, great prompt service. The food was spot on. Know that there items are not "Americanized", meaning that it's not sweet. Pretty traditional from what I sampled: steamed pork soup dumplings, spicy wontons (the shit!!!!), Sui Mai & pork-chives dumplings. $26 all in w tea. Stoked to find this spot.
author: Sen-Sei S.

description:
We ordered 5 orders from the restaurant. The delivery guy was rude and appeared to very unhappy when delivered the food.

I was very sick and my fiancé was too tired to cook after work. We ate the food. It tasted different. Not good. Not bad. Just different that we both couldn't eat more than a small bowl. It doesn't taste appetitive as we expected.
author: Ely T.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a good place to eat after exploring Golden Gate Park, and boy did we find one. We actually wanted to go to San Tung first, but like a bunch of other Yelpers, we ended up here after finding out the wait list (which was ridiculously long) had closed for the night. After trying Chang's, I'm glad it had. 

I came here with three other friends so we ordered a good amount of dishes and shared family style. Don't come to this place without trying the fried wonton strips. We started off with them as delicious snack to open our meal. The BBQ pork fried rice we shared was a great side to our entrees. The honey walnut prawn puts Panda Express to shame with its perfect glaze and flavor.  The roasted duck was just the right amount of fat under the crispy skin and had more than enough to go around. My favorite, the dry fried chicken wings, were an instant classic. With its crispy skin and savory garlic seasoning, I'd definitely come back just for these. 

The service was quick and polite, and they were nice even though we ended up being there 15 min past closing time. I would definitely recommend trying this place for anyone, especially those not wanting to wait forever at San Tung.
author: Tony T.

description: We are huge fans of Chang's Kitchen.  We love that we can enjoy a fresh and tasty meal, and even more than that, we love that Mr. Lu makes us feel so at home.  Mr. Lu always goes out of his way to make friends with our 2 year-old son, and so, going to Chang's Kitchen feels we are eating at a relative's home.  There are not enough good things that we can say about Mr. Lu and our many happy memories dining at Chang's Kitchen because of him.
author: Sophia C.

description:
4.5/5 stars but I rounded up to 5

My dad stopped by the city randomly and wanted to grab some dinner. We drove down Irving and spotted Chang's Kitchen (I remember seeing good reviews on yelp for this place) and looked for parking along the block. 

By the time we sat down it was almost 9 pm. They gave us some fried wonton strips with sweet and sour sauce (I guess it's their version of free bread at a "western" restaurant). I thought this was really interesting. 

They have a really extensive but not overwhelming menu. I also liked that they had a "meatless" section with classic dishes but made with imitation meats (perfect for my parents who are vegetarian). 

We ordered the wontons in chili oil, garlic fish in spicy sauce, and the kung pao meatless chicken. 

As we were waiting for our food, I checked yelp and realized that they closed at 9:30 pm (it was already like 9:10ish by the time we ordered). I felt so bad!! But they were so nice. People were still coming in closer to closing to order food to go. 

The wontons came out first and they were so good! I ate all 8 of them. My dads a vegetarian so he missed out on the delicious filling, but he did try some of the wonton skin with the sauce. He enjoyed the flavors as well. 

I didn't really care for the kung pao meatless chicken since I'm not a fan of imitation meats, but I ate the veggies that were cooked with it and I liked those. 

The fish dish came out last, but it was super fresh and tasty. I wish they had a non-fried option though.

The waitress lady was super nice and told us not to rush. I guess she heard me tell my dad they were closing soon. 

Will be back for the wontons and to try other dishes
author: Elisa Y.

description: Ordered delivery online through Yelp. I specifically asked them to only put green onions in my Mongolian Beef. I also ordered green onion pancakes and pot stickers. When the food showed up the Mongolian Beef was packed with yellow onions, green peppers, yellow peppers and a few small pieces of beef. The pot stickers and onion pancakes were both cold and hard.
author: Darius A.

description:
We had such a great experience here! We just parked and walked around because we needed food and were so happy to stumble upon this place. The wait staff was so kind and welcoming. We had tea and chips given upon arrival, and the whole place felt friendly and kind. On of the people in my party said "if you could taste the emotions from food this place would taste like happiness". One older gentleman, we believe his name was Louis, was particularly wonderful, joking with us and making us feel at home. 
It was a TON of food at such a great price! Would highly recommend :)
author: Jessica B.

description: The food was tasty--very hot and fresh!--but surprised to get both dishes with no rice. Also, the wings were just so-so.
author: Todd W.

description:
Went on a Sunday afternoon. The place was maybe 1/3 full. They can seat larger groups at a banquet table with a big lazy Susan or can push together several smaller tables. 

We were a party of 5. Got many dishes:
Bbq pork fried rice
Beijing chicken 
Broccoli beef
Hunan lamb
Mongolian beef
King pao chicken
Chicken with string beans
Salt and pepper halibut

All of the dishes tasted good. However the lamb, the Mongolian beef, and the Kung pao were a bit spicier than we were comfortable with. That staff were very friendly and attentive. We all agreed we would go back again.
author: parker p.

description: This is a great place to order from. I would suggest the Beijing Chicken. All types of potstickers are good I matter if they are vegetarian or with meat. The veggie chow mein is also great. The prices are reasonable. I hope to order from there again!!!!
author: Will D.

description: We get their food delivered to us in the outer Richmond.  The portions are generous. The dishes are delicious and the food arrives within a half hour and it is piping hot.  I certainly recommend them
author: Emily G.

description:
I ordered the Szechuan Dinner for two for delivery. Per their website at http://www.changskitchenchinese.com/ this should be: "FD03 Szechuan Dinner (for 2)
For 2: Wonton with Hot Chili Sauce, Hot and Sour Soup, Kung Pao Chicken, Mongolian Beef, Chicken Fried Pork (Spicy)"

However when it arrived I found there was no fried pork, I thought this was breaded pork fried like fried chicken (like chicken fried steak, or chicken fried pork chop). Instead it was chicken fried rice.

I called immediatly to find out what the deal was and the person I spoke to told me it was on their menu in house as chicken fried rice. I was a bit upset as this was the main thing I wanted to eat. He handed me to his boss who told me to call the person who made the website?? I asked if there was anything they could do and all she said is if I bring it to the restaurant (not an easy task at the moment) she would refund me. Otherwise she would do nothing.

She promptly told me she was busy and had to go and then hung up the phone.

Now I've had plenty of wrong orders before in my life and I really don't mind that much, I am a pretty friendly person. But the fact that they didn't care at all that I did not get what I was expecting and hung up on me really makes me upset. The least they could do is offer a replacement or give a discount. Anything other than rush me off the phone and basically tell me to "deal with it".

I won't be ordering from here again.
author: Arun Y.

description: Some of the better American-Chinese delivery to be had in the Sunset.  Good quality ingredients, everything is seasoned/spiced well, prices are decent, and delivery is quick.  Their mongolian beef chow mein is some of the best I've had in the city.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Chang's Kitchen is right across the street from San Tung, which unfortunately means that it gets overshadowed by its neighbor's dry fried chicken.  Don't be fooled by the lack of a 90 minute line though, Chiang's has food which is mighty delicious, if not quite on par with its neighbor.

Our group of 3 showed up around 445 and we're greeted by an empty restaurant.  Although a bit unnerving, this also meant that we were instantly seated.  Our servers were a bit slow to take our order, but not egregiously bad.

Our group got an order of pork buns, some general tso's chicken, and the Mongolian lamb.  I've been around the country trying variations on the good general's chicken, and let me tell you, nothing compares to what Chang's makes.  The outside has a perfectly crispy crust, and the sauce had a delightful mix of sweet, tangy, and just a bit of a kick.  Is it authentic chinese? Probably not.  Had I forgotten all about my lack of San Tung by the second bite?  Absofreakinglutely.

The pork buns were a bit on the small side and we're not quite as world - altering as the chicken, but they were definitely tasty and hit the pork bun spot which had been neglected for far too long.  I didn't get to try any of the lamb, but my girlfriend wouldn't let me steal her leftovers, so that's a seal of approval from her.

The portions weren't huge, but they also weren't tiny.  Plus, at around $9 for a main, the price is definitely right for food this delicious.

Taken together, Ching's isn't perfect,  but it delivers very tasty food at a reasonable price.  The service could be a bit quicker, but that's really the only gripe I have about this place.  If I'm ever craving a meeting with General Tso again I'll happily venture out to the Sunset to meet him here..
author: Jonathan M.

description: Really good and yummy food here. Been ordering from them for couple yrs already . The best Chinese food I ever had . The gentleman who works there (  host , manager , owner ) not sure - very nice guy and funny too. He always makes sure that his costumers are setisfied .
author: Tetyana G.

description: Went here with 4 friends - great place to do family style! I've lived in the city for 6 years, and this is one of the best places to get quality Chinese food. The eggplant is fantastic!
author: Nicolette L.

description: We placed a to-go order from Chang's of Won Ton soup, pork fried rice and the dry fried chicken wings. It was all pretty darn good - the chicken wings weren't spicy enough and weren't served with the chili peppers like they do across the street, but they were really well done! Everything else was tasty. I could order from Chang's again.
author: Alexander M.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for months, so I ordered pickup tonight for the first time, and the food was, no lie: disgusting. I'm honestly shocked at the five star reviews. It was BAD -- compared to any other junk-food Chinese delivery place (which I absolutely crave all the time), and certainly compared to real, authentic Chinese places. I only ate a few bites and I'm about to throw out the rest because I don't even want it sitting in my fridge.
