The walnut prawns were just overwhelmed with greasy batter sweating with mayonnaise -- and cutting them open I realized the shrimp wasn't cleaned well. That essentially means that there was a line of shrimp sh*t in my food.

The "tender veggies with garlic" was my attempt at eating some greens. It's a really simple dish -- hard to mess up -- but the bok choy was watery and stringy with random hard pieces. Like, bok choy does not have seeds -- what was I biting into that was hard? Ew. For the record, Yummy Yummy across the street has "seasonal veggies", made with the same ingredients, and it's 100x better.

The fried rice was edible for a few bites. I'm sure some people would like it -- there's nothing horrible about it -- but nothing great about it, either. After a few bites I didn't want to look at it anymore.

But the biggest letdown was the CRAB RANGOON. This was the reason I ordered Chinese food tonight -- I was craving crab rangoon like nothing else. Theirs was flat, boring batter, liquidy cream cheese with a celery aftertaste and chunks of really bad imitation crab. You can't understand how sad I feel right now.

My advice: get delivery from Emmy's if you want your greasy fried rice and crab rangoon fix. It's the best guilty-pleasure Chinese I've found in the city. Go to Yummy Yummy for great, garlicky vegetables (and a lot of other great stuff). Go to Burma Superstar for delicious honey walnut shrimp. And for any other Chinese dish, go ANYWHERE ELSE other than here.
author: Laura W.

description: The Walnut Shrimp, Combonation Fried Rice, and the Hot and Spicy Tofu is a must eat! This place is simply amazing. If your near this restaurant, well what are you waiting for go! This place has good yet inexpensive food! I love it! It's delivery is also very fast and the food is always fresh. The deliver also has a great attitude and is an amiable person. This place is highly recommended!
author: Bruce N.

description:
When I entered they immediately offered me a menu. I was surprised to see how affordable many of their dishes are. They have lunch specials which is awesome! 

I came in knowing I was going to order  General Tso chicken. It comes with white rice and an egg roll. The server was kind and patient with me while I asked her questions about the meal. She gave me a starter which was a small bowl of Sour Soup. It was delicious! Warm and flavorful! Also a teapot of tea. Tasted light and herbal which was great!

My meal arrived quickly but then again there were only a few tables so not sure how it would be if they were busier. 

My main course was plated beautifully. Looked colorful and appetizing. 

The General Tso chicken is some of the best I've ever had. White Rice was cooked nicely. Not super soft but not super hard. The little baby eggroll was good. Tasted differently then your typical eggrolls. 

Overall amazing experience! I recommend it! 

Recommendation
- Play Soft Music to enhance dine in experience.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Crazy to see how inconsistent reviews are for this place, but it might mean that they do certain things well and others terribly.  

I've ordered Chang's delivery 3 times now and we typically order the standard Chinese meat-laden order - Sweet and Sour Chicken, General Tso's Chicken, Steamed Pork Buns, and every single item we've ordered is the best of any Chinese food place we've ever had.  We're not snooty foodies though.
author: Scott S.

description: Unfortunately, the dinner gave our family bad indigestion. Also the chicken wings had a strong granulated sugar taste.
author: Fred H.

description: The dry fried chicken is tasty. So maybe the westernized dishes are good. The non-westernized dishes are not very authentic; you can get actually authentic food in the neighborhood for cheaper.
author: Keito U.

description:
Great Food.
MASSIVE flavors.
Good Portions.
Very Spacious!!
Huge serine Clean Restrooms.
Friendly Staff.
Speedy service.
Great environment.
Best part-No lines!!:)
author: Hung L.

description: Ordered delivery: Sweet & Sour chicken and General Tsao's Chicken with steamed rice.  The taste of the sauce was very good, but it seemed to be mostly breading I was eating and not much chicken at all which is not very appetizing. Not sure I'll order from here again for a while, and if I do, it will probably be for noodles or rice only.
author: Mr. B.

description: Delicious food, funny waiter, excellent service. I love Chang's--it's become my go to place for Chinese takeout in the Sunset. The deep fried chicken wings are AMAZING--definitely give them a try!
author: Daphne W.

description: This is a SF hidden gem. If I could give 6 stars, I would. The man that waited on us made our night so fun and was so accommodating. The won tons in hot chili sauce are a must! We will definitely be back.
author: Jess Y.

description:
This place has the dubious distinction of being directly across from one of the more famous Chinese places in the area, San Tung (and San Tung 2). You might think that this would set you up for disappointment, but on the contrary we were pleasantly surprised. We went with a friend of mine who has several young kids, and they were very accommodating (a big plus). Not only that, but when they found out the middle kid was having a birthday in a few days they somehow produced a stuffed animal toy as a gift for her. Who knew?

As for the food, I thought it was quite good. I went for the general Tso chicken while my wife had one of the eggplant clay pots. Both were very good and flavorful. We also had one of the dim sum samplers, and all of those items were good as well. 

Overall, we had a great experience here and will be happy to come back.
author: Brent W.

description: Love Chang's Kitchen! We go all the time, they remember us, and the food is always delicious. Totally recommend, especially since it's right across from a great, but often crazy busy (and more expensive) alternative.
author: Jeff L.

description: I live nearby. I love coming here because the staff is so friendly! They always welcome me with a warm smile and get everything right the first time. The food is great and I will be a lifetime customer! The food here is nothing short of fabulous!
author: Tony P.

description:
Tonight I had the greatest experience at Chang's Kitchen. I did not want to wait at the restaurant across the street, so I took a chance on Chang's, which had no wait.
I ordered the Wonton with Chili Sauce as an appetizer,  and they were excellent, but not fancy. I then had the Shreaded Pork w/ Bean Sauce, which was PERFECT!  I can't wait to go back-maybe tomorrow night.
author: Richard C.

description: I only order delivery from this place.  Food is really good!  The sizzling rice soup is excellent - a ton of vegetables, tender chicken, and water chestnuts !!!  I've also ordered the salt and pepper wings -  so good. I ordered 8 orders for poker night.  Everyone raved about them.
author: Anna L.

description: Amazing Chinese food. I ordered the orange chicken and Vegetable Chow Mein to go. They were super quick. Big portions! Definitely will be back.
author: Jamie G.

description:
Surprisingly good!
At a popular location, was going around there for lunch, happy to find a seat without waiting. The food was nice, steamy hot, tasty but not overwhelming,  a lot of places want to pack so much flavor in their food would make it too salty, no good for the health conscious bunch. We ordered the pan fried noodles, dumplings and the fried chicken wings and they were nicely made just right.
Even better, its price is more reaonable, can't beat the value.
Will definitely go back.
author: Bill C.

description:
Initially our group had planned to go to San Tung after a very nice day at the Golden Gate Park but due to the very long wait I did what every other yelpers do and rely on YELP to save the day haha. Seated almost immediately we walked in and ohhh my goshhhhh was the food GREAT, I kid you not all entrees ordered were very tasty! Be sure to order the Honey Walnut PRAWNS they are amazeballs, and for $11 *winning* food items came out fairly quick, fresh AND hot *double winning*

Not to mention the service was great, we were welcomed and served by the owners themselves now that's something you don't see often. Being that we were a fairly large group the hospitality was as if we were just 2. They were very accomodating responding to our requests and needs. They were awesome and hilarious. Great atmosphere!!!!

Definitely returning on our next visit.
author: Jackie Lyn L.

description: Best Chinese Food in the Inner Sunset! The walnut prawns are phenomenal! Excellent service...clean. Haven't ever had a dish I didn't like.
author: Amy L.

description: General Tso's Chicken is delicious and nice that it gives you an option to choose your spice level. +++Free Crab Rangoon, are you kidding me? So good.
author: Reilly W.

description: Omg! I came all the way down from bay shore to here is to eat there Dried fried chicken wings ! It's crispy and I really like the sweet and sour taste! Not like the traditional sweet and sour taste like General chicken. Highly suggest the hot and sour soup it's a amazing combination with tofu egg and veggies. The waitress are nice and especially they serve quite fast.
author: Ann H.

description:
What a disaster. 

Walked in around 9pm on a weeknight and was seated by an older chinese gentleman who was actually really nice. The pleasant experience ended there.

Ordered Shu Mai and Har Gow and after eating a couple, I noticed that they weren't really very warm. I cut open the dim sum pieces and found that both the Shu Mai and the Har Gow were still raw! NASTY. The shrimp wasn't even slightly pink, it was straight up black and white still. 

In a few hours I'll find out if I end up sick, but I can tell you I am never coming back here.

Even worse, when I asked for the check to get out of there, they tried to charge me for half of the meal that I had already eaten.. what a joke. Of course, I wasn't having that so in the end they ended up not charging me. 

What a shame. I had high hopes for this place. But raw Har Gow AND Shu Mai; thats a double screw up. Don't come here unless you want to get sick.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Hong Kong ABC here, if you're Chinese, not the place for authentic specific food. Came here with the parent and my dad said "they do Cantonese, shanghainese, and sichuan" which usually indicates not specializing in one. If you don't know, then this review shouldn't matter. If you do then this is all you need to read. 

The main crux of this place is if you're looking for "a Chinese takeout" place as an American, this will do the trick and you shouldn't be too concerned of this rating. Then again you're in SF... so you should do better.

On second look, the other reviews are mostly from non-asians. 

Look at the highlights: general tso's, etc, you know what you're getting. More American tastes should be fine with this place.
author: Byron C.

description:
Best Chinese food in the Sunset. Please tell me if there is better? Chinese food is one of my favorite foods and it took me awhile to find a decent Chinese restaurant. Even though the sunset is the real China town? I order delivery from here once a week. I have never gotten sick. The meats and seafoods are decent quality. Better than most in the sunset. Service is great. If you have any problem with their food just tell them and they will accommodate you.

WHAT To ORDER

Fried won tons
Sweet and sour chicken or pork
General tso chicken
Sesame chicken
Kung pao chicken
Combination wonton soup
BBQ pork chow mein (light oil) add green onion
Lemon chicken
Fried rice (any combo is great)
Walnut Prawns
author: Roman J.

description:
I. Love. This. Place. 

The General Tso's is amazing, the crab wontons are amazing, the Chinese broccoli is amazing. Everything is amazing. 

But most importantly- the people! It might sound weird to call a Chinese restaurant a home away from home but when you're working and living in the city it's a reality. The owners are so kind. They are hilarious, hardworking and always offer service with a smile. They even let me turn on jeopardy if I'm here at 7. 

It's easy to want to draw comparisons to San Tung- but this place is light years ahead. Save the long lines and rushed service for the tourists.
author: Kyleen B.

description:
We went to San Francisco on New Year's Day with our family friend Sophie's hiking club. Our group was deciding where to go for lunch when we passed Chang's Kitchen. Sophie and her husband happen to have the surname of Chang, so I jokingly suggested that we should eat at "their" restaurant. The funny thing is that we actually ended up eating here as it was one of the few nicer-looking eateries that was open on New Year's Day.

The first thing I noticed was that the menu had a huge selection of items. I didn't do an exact count, but I estimate there were well over 150 dishes. The prices were also pretty attractive, with many of the entrées being in the sub-$10 range. Even the daily specials were relatively cheap.

The food itself was pretty good. Per family tradition, each of us ordered different dishes to share; the salmon fried rice was my personal favorite, but everything else was also delicious. Although Mom noted the salmon in the fried rice was slightly overcooked, and that the food made her thirsty for some time, the three of us overall enjoyed everything.

The interior of Chang's Kitchen is pretty small, and our group easily took up two-fifths of the tables. The restaurant was mostly empty when we arrived, but it did become a little crowded when more people started showing up. But other than the limited seating and the saltiness of some of the food, I have no real complaints.

-- TL;DR version --

Highs: Huge menu selection; great prices
Lows: Somewhat crowded interior; food is somewhat thirst-inducing
Final verdict: Chang's Kitchen offers a huge variety of good Chinese food at extremely affordable prices.
Bottom line: 4.1 stars (rounded down to four)
author: Danny C.

description: There orange chicken is to die for!!!!!!! And i am SOOOOOO PICKYY with chinese food. Its a little spicy and i hate spicy food but this chicken had me drooling for days!
author: Keyla C.

description: I ordered delivery from them. I had the vegan General Tso chicken and my boyfriend had the regular General Tso chicken and they were both really good. I think this will be my new go to delivery place!
author: Lori L.

description: Well we tried to go to San Tung, but so long of a wait. Decided to try this restaurant since it was across the street. Reason we were going to try San Tung because we hear folks rave about their Dried Fried Chicken wings. Well we ordered them here aand my daughter stated they are just as goid. So folks why wait for hours for San Tung because the food is just as good!. This restaurant is clean and service is good.
author: Nancy F.

description: Food was amazing. Service was amazing. I would eat here over San Tung any day! Definitely a quick and delicious go-to place in the sunset.
author: janet r.

description:
Really tasty. Ordered on eat24 and it came in less than 20 min and the food was too hot to eat immodestly. But it was delicious. And for the cost you get lots of food. Enough for left overs!

Got the general tso's chicken - got it medium. It was spicy and Delish. Nice crunch to it. The sauce was amazing. I loved this. My only gripe is there was very little veggies. Less than 10 pieces and most were green peppers.

Also got Mongolian beef. The sauce on this was also really tasty. Medium spice. Less spicy than General tso's. But yummy! A little too many onions but the beef was well seasoned and tender. 

Asked for chopsticks and some extra sauces on my order and didn't get them. But that's ok. It was all good. Definitely will return.
author: Beth E.

description: Fantastic Chinese food. And they deliver. I would stack this up against San Tung, given it's so much easier to actually get food without long wait times.
author: Anil C.

description:
Ordered food delivery via Eat24 and food arrived literally within 20 minutes. Makes me kinda wonder why so fast....
I ordered:

Spinach w garlic - meh! it was a good portion size. I took about 2 bites out of it and that was it. 

Shrimp and scallops w two kinds of mushroom- The mushrooms tasted kinda funky...it had a bitter taste to it. It's kinda like eating  some week old food that's been marinating in old sauce that was left out of the hot kitchen for some time. Bottom line- it tasted OLD and FONKAY (not funky but FONKAY)

Chicken corn soup- bland...no taste.....where's the corn? it looked like someone put in two cups of water and half an egg. Down the drain it went. 

Sorry Chang's Kitchen, but you guys gotta step it up a couple of notches if you want to have more business. 

I should've gone down to Subway and saved my $26 dollars... damn!
author: Annette F.

description: We ordered delivery last night. Everything was just ok. The BBQ pork chowmein was oily, the lemongrass and green bean chicken lacked any flavor and the sauce was broken and thick. Overall not awful, but definitely won't order again. There are so many other spots to choose from.
author: Eileen F.

description: The Chinese Broccoli Beef was excellent! Honey Walnut Shrimp mouth watering and the Vegetable Chow Mein hit the spot. Halibut with Tender Veges (choi sum) was very good too. Our pick up order was late but all was forgiven when we had a taste of that yummy goodness.
author: Marie M.

description:
Wow happy I came across this all because of their flyer! Fresh, convenient and inexpensive! 1/2 duck, mongolian beef, wonton soup, snow peas chicken, pork fried rice, spicy string beans all for $57! 

Great friendly service and no wait! My family will be back!
author: Morning S.

description: Bland. Not bad just flavorless the salt and pepper prawn was just battered with no seasoning. The beef chow mein literally could have been bare spaghetti noodles and the generals chicken was greasy and uninteresting. The dim sum was good got the sampler.
author: J R.

description:
I found a place with better dry-fried wings than San Tung! There, I said it. These are better. Great food all around. Great prices and exceptional, friendly service. 

We will be back!
author: Dave S.

description:
Excellent Chinese food. Just as good as San Tung down the street. If you want San Tung style quality without having to wait an hour for a table, then Chang's Kitchen is your best bet. 

The dry fried chicken is very good, just like San Tung. Great rice, great dim sum, excellent egg rolls too. Love the Honey walnut prawns. 

Prices are good, comparable to San Tung. Try it!
author: Helen K.

description: Sunset district residents rejoice!  It's no longer necessary to travel to the Richmond or Chinatown for good Chinese food.  That's right, we now have an honest-to-Buddha Chinese restaurant in a neighborhood formerly dominated by San Tung but otherwise devoid of a good Chinese restaurant.  While the food here may not be "to die for" (who would want that, anyway?), these folks definitely know how to cook.  The service is efficient and friendly, and the portions are generous.  Recommended!
author: Richard A.

description:
I usually don't really write reviews or I don't want to leave any bad reviews.. but this one I needed to. 

I ordered Eggplant with Garlic Sauce and Walnut Prawns. The food came in 40 mins which was okay. 

Prawns were okay, but too creamy. And the lettuce under the prawns was really old and all brown. It tasted really bad too. If I saw that before I ate some prawns, I would've called the restaurant and returned my food. 

And I'm usually a big fan of eggplant with garlic sauce from any Chinese restaurants and I've tried from various places but this eggplant dish tasted really weird. And it was very oily and soupy. Not saucy. I couldn't have more than few bites. It's maybe just more traditional or a different type of Chinese food. I still have that weird oil or vegetable taste left in my mouth. I can't even say if it was good or bad because it was impossible for me to eat. 

The delivery service and portion was fine.
author: Seul K.

description:
Happened to come upon this place looking for dinner. My boyfriend and I weren't really in the mood for anything in particular, so we decided to stop here since it was the first place we passed after parking. Everything was great! We got Kung pao shrimp, general chicken, salt and pepper chicken wings, and steamed rice. The portions were generous and the flavors of everything were exactly what we wanted!
Most importantly, the service was fantastic. There were two gentlemen tending to the dining room and they were both so attentive and nice. It can be hard finding good service around here so it was so refreshing and very appreciated. 
We will definitely be going back there many times, especially for the salt and pepper wings!
author: Karissa Q.

description: Yuck. Yelp let me down. Because of lots of other high reviews, I got the Walnut Shrimp which was mushy and tasted basically like breaded shrimp drowned in globs of sweet mayo (with about 5 walnuts thrown in. To be fair, I got delivery. Hopefully it's better fresh out of the kitchen, but I wouldn't try it again. The bbq pork fried rice - while, as others mentioned - was not greasy, it also was not flavorful in the least.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Liked the menu that they had on Eat 24 and gave this place a try. 

Fast delivery (35-40 minutes when they said 60) and the food was GREAT. Had the Szechuan (hot) family menu for 2 ($25). Hot and sour soup, chili oil won ton, Kung Pao chicken, Mongolian beef and fried rice (had shrimp and scallops in it). All cooked to perfection, not too hot and LOTS of food. Could feed 4 easily. 

Enough for 4 or two nights of dinner... Check it out.
author: Debbie C.

description: You say you want good Chinese Delivery - then look no further - this has become our go to spot for sure and we prob order at least 1x per week from here and have been rarely disappointed!! - now, this sits across street from Sun Tang, famous for their dry fried chick wings (rightly so - they are amazing!!) - BUT, Chang's does their own DF Chicken wings which are OUTSTANDING - great sauce on top of perefectly cooked and crispy chicken wings - if you like ST, you'll like these a lot - not to be confused with the appetizer salt & pepper wings, which are good, but I'd like to see them use the same prep on the SP wings as the DF wings sans sauce...anyway, another staple - chicken corn soup - you want comfort in a hot, piping bowl of viscous, egg white, asian rift on chicken soup - then here ya go!!! - rest of menu is all pretty standard, but they do give you brown rice options on all fried rices, which is really nice!!
author: Richard D.

description: Honestly one of the best Chinese places in the city and certainly the nicest owner/waiter.
author: Markus S.

description: The best Chinese food i ever had I was so surprise they deliver so fast and hot and driver was so nice I highly recommend mongolian beef chicken wing and walnut prawn their pice are so cheap and the package is so good not a sauce drip
author: Mia Z.

description: My new takeout fav. Satisfies my Yang Chow cravings by not skimping on the tasty bits!
author: Daniel F.

description: I've not eaten enough dishes here to give it a better review, but we ordered Chinese delivery for the first time ever and by surprise, dinner was very satisfying. Finally, a good restaurant very close to home that delivers. Delivery was on time, food was cheap and of course, salty - specifically what I was craving that night. There is nothing healthy about Chinese take-out EVER. So this is only a good idea for those bad days.
author: Thao T.

description: We just ordered two dishes (mapo tofu and Korean BBQ) and I have to say it was the worst I've ever had!  I have no idea how this place has gotten four stars!
author: Mitra C.

description: This place is great. San Tung is right across the street and is always super busy but this place is just as good. Dry fried chicken wings and eggplant with garlic sauce are both excellent. And the twice cooked pork is the best I've had in SF.
author: Duncan S.

description: We came here because San Tung was too packed and we were really hungry. Food was good, fast, hot and reminded me of home in Rowland Heights, lol. The service was really good too. Our server was patient with our group of 7.
author: Michelle C.

description: The lunch specials are an excellent deal and they deliver them. The items were hot and miss. Very low quality meat - like the beef had a weird consistency. Hated the cloyingly sweet mango beef. Shrimp and salmon dishes were better, especially the one with scrambled eggs. Also, ordered delivery online and explicitly asked for a 12:15 delivery and they brought it at 11:20.
author: Andrew K.

description: Really good Chinese!  Very large portions, quick service, funny waiter, great food, reasonable prices.  What more could you ask for?  The 3 of us had the Chef Special Salmon fried rice, the mock chicken moo shoo and a dish with prawns, scallops and mushrooms.  All were excellent and plenty to take home for another meal of left-overs. Probably the best fried rice we ever had.
author: Marc V.

description:
Second time I get to-go here and they are so funny. Really nice customer service, and the food is good!! Thought about getting some food at sung tung, but there was a long line, so we went across the street and got our yummy food in 10 mins.

Phenomenal: lemon chicken, dry fried chicken wings, Mongolian beef. Pretty big portions and I can eat a lot! Enough for a couple to share with two orders of steamed rice and be super full. Also, free range chicken! 

Owner is the nicest man ever, and it's nice to just even be Acknowledged  than when they don't even look at you when they talk to you at Sung Tung.
author: Anna B.

description: The food here is OK. A lot better than I would've expected seeing as how there are always super empty inside. Right across the street from Santungs so they really do have to keep up with the competition. They have Drive fried chicken on the menu as well but it is not nearly the same, do not order Dry fried chicken here if you're craving Santungs, it's completely different mine turned out to be like sesame chicken soggy and sauced up. The honey walnut shrimp was good, still not as good as across the street. The only thing I could ever really crave from there is the sweet-and-sour chicken which was better than OK but definitely not the best. Delivery is fast can't complain about that!!
author: Natasha P.

description: This place is awesome and the wait staff are super friendly! Especially Lou! They helped us host our red egg and ginger party for my daughter - I feel like I could not have picked a better venue for 40 people. Coordinating everything was super easy with Lou (who I think manages the place). The food was great and the price was right! Totally recommend this place for groups, parties, or just for a simple lunch or dinner :)
author: Ceanne H.

description: The waiters were too slow to react and never bothered to answer us and did their own thing.
author: David L.

description:
Changs kitchen. 
It's a really generic name, but the food there is awesome. We got noodles and sweet and sour pork and fried wontons and it was all pretty good. There was a very large group of us present and they were super accommodating. The food is awesome but what makes this place worth coming back is the awesome service. Will definitely be back.
author: Sean S.

description: I love the dry fried chicken! I eat at Changs more than any other restaurant. I first ate at Chang's when it was called Golden Rice Bowl because San Tung's across the street was mean to my brother and me and I've never had to go back because i like Chang's food better and the people way better.
author: Anna M.

description:
I placed an order for delivery and my order was delivered in a timely manner, however when I opened the package the soup I had ordered had spilled all over the place causing a big mess and disappointment .
 Quality of the food is just ok.
author: Marilton D.

description:
I've been ordering here for the longest time. This place used to be called Golden Rice Bowl, but now they changed it to Chang's Kitchen. The food still taste delicious and to be honest, even better than before! Customer service here is specaticular, and the waiters and waitresses are very friendly and helpful.

I usually get the dry fried chicken wing, lemon chicken, and an order of chicken fried rice. The food is amazing and it is worth the price because they give you very big portions of food. Most of the time when I come here, I have a lot left over, so I usually take it home and finish it for lunch the next day. 

I also found out that they do deliveries. You can order from them online through Grubhub. The delivery is very fast and the delivery guy is very friendly! Definitely be sure to give Chang's Kitchen a try when you are in the neighborhood or just give them a call!
author: Lisa B.

description: Came here from out of town looking for chinese food during my 30mins wait time before my hair cut appointment. I ordered shrimp fried rice to go, but since I have a little more time, I decided to sit down for another 5 min before walking back to the hair salon. The cashier person who took my order was having a bad attitude because I decided to sit down. Very bad customer services. I would not recommend this place.
author: The Critic C.

description: This is my first YELP review.  I've ordered delivery with the Uber Eats app from this restaurant on a few occasions, but my rating is for this particular meal.  As a vegetarian I appreciate their wide selection of vegetable dishes and faux meat entrees.  Although not outstanding, it is much appreciated.  However on this occasion I ordered the string beans with fried tofu.  It was the worst dish ever, and the sting beans were raw.  Not al dente, but raw, with no flavor whatsoever.  Steer clear of this dish.   I also ordered the chow fun with gravy rather than my usual dried chow fun.  Again, absolutely no flavor.  Really disappointed as the food is usually better.
author: Robert W.

description:
Checked out this place because of the reviews and was devastatingly disappointed. Our waiter was extremely temperamental because he did not understand our order and when we explained it to him in both English and Chinese he got frustrated. Not surprisingly, our order still came out wrong. The xiao long bao skin was dry and the meat did not taste fresh. Their veggie dish with homemade fishball was too salty. 

Two redeeming factors: the dried fried chicken wings were very good. Piping hot with a delicious sweet sauce. The older man who greeted us was very sweet and accommodating. However these two factors do not compensate for the negative aspects I've experienced while dining here. If I do return, I would only order the chicken wings TO GO.
author: Ilene L.

description: Ordered for delivery, we got the Korean BBQ ribs, honey walnut prawns and house fried rice. It was delicious and would definitely order from them again. Loved it!
author: Thanh V.

description: We just had our food delivered through Eat24 and it is absolutely delicious! Unfortunately I was at the store and my girlfriend didn't have much tip money (a measly 2.00) so I figured I would write a review. Also, we just found our new favorite chinese food! we ordered wonton soup, walnut shrimp, salt and pepper pork ribs, and egg rolls. Next time we will be sure to tip in a better manner. Sorry delivery guy! Also, these are fair sized portions. Not as big as I had wished but not small enough to complain.
author: Matt T.

description: This place has become my go to for Chinese delivery in the area.  Delivery is usually quick and they do a good job packaging. The food is actually better than the place across the street but don't tell that to the lemmings who like to wait in line for mediocre food. I do hope they survive since this location has never been able to make it work.
author: Eric C.

description: I got the Mongolian beef with noodles, fried chicken wings, and crab ragoons for take-out. It served 4 people generously. Chose medium-spicy and had no spice at all, next time I'll choose hot. This place gives you A LOT of food! Great deal and tasted great too. Friendly service and it was warm and ready when I went to pick it up.
author: Katie L.

description:
Good was sooo good!! Being from the sunset and coming back to visit this is prob the best I've had in years. Fresh tasting. The lemon chicken is a must!! 

Service was alright. Poor guy seemed overwhelmed but was friendly enough.. Don't let that scare you.. It's a must try!!
author: Destiny O.

description: Delicious hot and sour soup delivered. Showed up in the time allotted, piping hot, and could include tip with the online payment so it wasn't a problem that I was out of cash. Great to have this option in the neighborhood
author: Gigi S.

description: We got delivery. The pork fried rice was awesome and the sautéed green beans were a massive highlight. The sweet and sour pork was one of the best sweet and sour pork a I've ever had. The delivery was super fast and the food was really good! Highly recommend!
author: Jacob B.

description:
This place had a re decoration and name change. Same people. Very friendly and helpful but the food is mediocre to bad Ordered takeout. Walnut prawns. Very decent good sized and flavorful. 
Black bean shrimp. 
Counted 6 small shrimp in order  sauce was generic and bad. Very disappointed.
 Seafood chow fun. Seemed to be same sauce as black bean shrimp
This may have been an off night but this meal was not worth the price
author: Lambchop B.

description: Kind of typical Chinese food. Good flavor. Actually seems a bit less greasy and unhealthy than other Chinese restaurants I've been to.
author: Andrew P.

description: Being opposite of Santung... It's not easy for Changs kitchen. However, they've been consistently outstanding in terms of the food quality, portions, and price. I know people can be put off by the mostly half empty restaurant. But compare to waiting 2 hours at Santung, I'd gladly patronize this joint. Their takeout is great too!
author: Davis W.

description: My favorite Chinese food spot in San Francisco. They have delicious dry fried chicken wings and everything else is great too!! They have excellent service and are very nice! Would definitely keep going here and recommend it to everyone!
author: Yolanda D.

description: Dry fried wings prepared in the same manner as San Tung across the street. Quality is nearly as good if not just as good, but without any wait. Rest of the menu items are solid too. I have yet to be disappointed by anything I've ordered here, and the staff is extremely friendly!
author: Matt W.

description:
We were originally planning to go to Yummy Yummy and there was a wait.  I went on yelp and saw that it has a 4 star and decided to give it a try.  Very good food and service.  Things we ordered

house special chow mein - very good
phoenix and eggplant - very good
stir fry pea sprouts - good
westlake beef soup - very good

We will definitely come again.
author: AB H.

description: We stopped by today for lunch, the customer service was great and so was the food. We kept it simple dim sum, hot and sour soup and a main dish. What I liked the most was the food had a lot of flavor and very little to no grease.  We will be back.
author: Susan S.

description:
Do not order anything involving dough: potstickers, steamed buns, mu shu pancakes, etc. The wrappers are very thick and doughy.

Other than that, all I tried was mu shu chicken. Chicken was sparse. The vegetables were crudely chopped. There was an unusual lack of egg. It was very oily.

I would say the Golden Bowl formerly in this location was better, and it was mediocre. Wait in line at San Tung instead.
author: Crabcakes C.

description: The service is really bad.. Food isn't that good either, do not order the beef noodle soup
author: Joshua L.

description:
There is no quality control both in cooking and servicing.
We ordered some fish. It was wrapped in msg and we couldn't taste the fish.
And the bok choy was bitter.
The service was bad also even though it was not that busy.
author: andy s.

description: Finally a Chinese restaurant where the people actually have some personality. They are attentive, they Smile, and it feels genuine. Oh and the food is good. Everything is as good or better than the place across the street and no lines. Try this place.
author: H L.

description: Hot and sour soup was tasty.. Pork dumplings were juicy.. Dry fried chicken wings were ok.. Wait staffs were very friendly.  An alternative when you dont wait an hour at San Tung.
author: Eva L.

description: Their chicken wings are NOT like San Tung's. They were soggy, over-sauced, and did not have much flavor. We also ordered the mongolian beef chow mien which was drenched in spices and had a crunch due to the overload of spices added. The flavor was terrible and we ended up having to throw them out. This place does have better food here, but definitely not what we ordered today.
author: Amelia E.

description: We used to order from Golden Rice Bowl at least once a month. When they changed over to Chang's Kitchen, you could tell things were different. The food is less flavorful than it was before, the soup and potstickers are completely disappointing. At first we thought it was a fluke, but now know it's something different. A completely different restaurant!
author: Domenique B.

description: Delicious, low cost $!!! Staff is friendly atmosphere is nice, clean. Give this place a ten!
author: Marisa L.

description: Rice bowl was decent Chinese but I don t know if they got a new chef for Changs but the food is really substandard. Walnut prawns were greasy and tasted old. I was not happy and will not use them again
author: Lamb C.

description:
I had one of their flyers on my door and usually won't order full take out without at least checking the place out in person first.  However, my go-to place wasn't open yet and the overall Yelp reviews seemed positive.  

So I ordered pretty standard stuff:  Broccoli beef, sweet and sour pork, bbq pork chow mein, snow peas with water chestnuts and the General's chicken.  With tax and tip it came to $50.  I was told it would take from 30-45 minutes for delivery.  They arrive in less than 30, which was great, but I was waiting on people and the 45 minute time frame would have worked out better.

All of the dishes were excellent.  The vegetables were crunchy and the sauces were flavorful.  The only complaint is with the snow peas with water chestnuts.  It was more like chopped celery with a few snow peas thrown in.

The best part is that after eating I didn't get really thirsty, which is usually a tell tale sign of MSG, right?  The flyer had coupons for a free item, which I didn't use because I wasn't sure of the quality of the food.  It also had a stamp card on the back, which, again, I didn't use.  Maybe next time.  And there will be a next time!
author: Kim K.

description: Originally came to the area for San Tung, but was discouraged by the line. Chang's was a pleasant surprise! The best aspect of this restaurant is absolutely the service. I'm gluten free and have major food allergies, so Chinese restaurants are usually a no-go zone for me. However, the manager of the restaurant went out of his way to accommodate my situation. I was able to order a customized dish and they allowed me to pick exactly what went into my food. I was absolutely floored by their attentiveness and highly recommend this place for anyone who wants the experience of a Chinese restaurant without the typical brusque service that accompanies it.
author: Addison Y.

description: The dumplings were not edible and the chowfun was tasteless and very greasy. This was an extremely disappointing meal.
author: Linda B.

description: The food here is delicious. I originally walked over to grab food at Sam Tung across the street but they were closed from 3-5pm, so I ducked into Chang's for a quick bite instead. Had the Mongolian beef (spicy) and the green onion pancake. Both were delicious and authentic. Not to mention, the service was wonderful.
author: Dennis C.

description: I ordered orange chicken, vegetable chow mein and chicken chow fun. Right after I had orange chicken my stomach was feeling weird and half an hour later, I was feeling sick and I threw up. I strongly recommend not ordering from here.
author: Daiya M.

description: EXTREMELY salty, and I generally like salty food. My meat was gross- it didn't taste real at all and pretty much dissolved in the sauce. No taste. I ordered the Mongolian beef, Kung Pao chicken, chicken fried rice, and egg rolls- pretty standard and popular dishes that shouldn't be too hard to make. Not sure why this has four stars.
author: Sara C.

description: Not enough chicken in the General Tso's Chicken; too much breading, too many phantom pieces (all flour, no chicken).
author: Inigo M.

description: Came here with my family and had their chicken wings, hot and sour soup, fried rice, green beans, spicy beef and eggplant. Three out of four of us came down with severe food poisoning that started 2 hours after we ate and my sickness has lasted six days. At first I thought It was too much MSG but the pains got worse and I was bed ridden and exhausted. This was the only meal we ate together that day with the same food. Mine was the worst and I ate more of the eggplant. My son is the only one who didn't get sick and he also didn't eat as much or touch the eggplant. It was a terrible experience. This is very concerning if your young children can get seriously ill. I read a few more reviews here that stated others got food poisoning also so I don't think it's just my problem. Be aware of this place.
author: Bay M.

description: My favorite Chinese delivery spot. Have ordered from them multiple times and they never disappoint. Just had the Szechuan fish fillet and it's amazing - definitely ordering again.
author: Matt F.

description: This is the best Chinese restaurant ever!! My family was Hungary for some Chinese food. We ordered online and the delivery came every fast. We were so happy the food was out of this world. We order General chicken, Mongolian beef, walnut prawn, and spring roll. We highly recommend this restaurant. The deliver was very friendly and nice.
author: Andy W.

description: I don't eat here as often I used too but the happy go lucky server, I don't know his name is always a joy to see. I used to work at St. Anne's and always ordered pick up for lunch from the previous restaurant. He's always very nice and jones around. I had lunch there today with my sister and nieces. Food was good and environment quiet. We didn't feel rushed like if we're ate at San Tung across the street. Even though it's not a popular restaurant, the food is good and service was great.
author: Judy M.

description: I have gotten delivery from this place three times and ordered out once and i have not been disappointed yet :). Great hot and sour soup, mu shu, and mongolian beef! Portions are great, and prices very reasonable.  I am surprised this place does not have more reviews.
author: minnie l.

description: Those who say this place has better dry fried chicken wings than San Tung are just too lazy to wait in line across the street. It didn't quite have the balance of sweet / spicy / sticky that San Tung has, but admittedly it still hit the spot. Ordered it take out,  along with the beef chow fun. Come here if you want something much cheaper and filling.  Food was ready much earlier than anticipated,  and it was still steaming hot when I opened it up at home.  Overall,  I recommend.
author: Ronald T.

description: Being overshadowed by it's cousin San Tung, Chang's food is really good WITHOUT THE WAIT! I've been coming here for awhile and have yet to be disappointed.
author: Justin E.

description: I tried to order from my regular delivery spot but they  were on vacation so I tried Chang's Kitchen again because they are close.  Food arrived quickly.  The first chicken/veggie dish was ok, but lacking in spices.  It was bland and even though I could see lots of what looked like garlic, I couldn't taste it.  The second dish was pork with garlic sauce.  What this looked like was just a big container of stir fried onions with very little pork.  The sauce was like a watered down sweet and sour sauce.  The rice was just fine
author: Dennis M.

description:
This place is so great! They changed their name from Golden Rice Bowl to Chang's 
kitchen which surprised me a bit but they still have the same quality service as they did before. I love ordering the sesame chicken and the walnut prawns, they are so good! The customer service is great (especially Lou!) and the owners are very friendly. Stop by, you won't regret it!
author: Tidani B.

description: This is our family's go to Chinese restaurant. We order pot stickers, Chinese broccoli with garlic, a chow mein, and the Beijing chicken most commonly. The food is well made, delivered quickly and reliably, and I love the ease of ordering through Yelp. Changs is an improvement in good quality over other restaurants at this address and we are fans for their delivery service. Recommended!
author: Scott D.

description: OH MAN, practically inedible. My boyfriend wouldn't even eat it... (and he typically eats the majority of Chinese and leftovers). It just tasted wrong-especially the veggies. It's almost like they had soaked the veggies in putrid water prior to cooking, and they DEFINITELY kept that flavor. I'm so very disappointed. DON'T DO IT.
author: Megan M.

description: This is one of my regular spots for casual Chinese food. Easy to order to go or dine-in and they have a great lunch menu. Servers are nice and food is served fast, which is great when you're on the go. Portions are a good size too. Some of my favorites are broccoli beef, general tsao's chicken, egg drop soup, fish with sweet corn and their veggie dishes with tofu and mushrooms.
author: Jenn J.

description: Amazing place!! All the dishes are well serve! Super tasty! Came for dinner with my sister and order a family dinner special for 12.95 per person! Don't have no regrets!!
author: Jose L.

description: This place is incredible!! No reason to wait in the line across the street. The service here is so wonderful they're all so sweet and helpful and the food oh my god it's divine. The veggie potstickers were flavorful and delicious, the wonton soup was a beautiful classic and yummy and the combo chow mein hong kong style noodle was one of the best i've ever had. Thank you for the great experience Chang's!!
author: Blake B.

description: Cheap, quick, kind, and much less stressful than San Tung. basic good American-style Chinese food. 10/10 would eat there again.
author: Eli F.

description: Wow, these people are the worst.  Total bait and switch!  Beware if you are ordering takeout or delivery.  What the menu says and what they charge are not the same. By hear people add extra on their items and then offer you a free item to make up for the next time.  My order should have been $40 and they charged me $48.  A little here a lot there.  I asked for an itemized receipt which they did not send.  They texted me the amounts they charged after the fact and I was horrified to see nothing on the menu was what they charged.  They made excuses for everything and wound up offering me a free item next time.  After I said I would report them they said they would credit me.  This only happened because I complained.  Don't order take out unless you go over every item before and also once you get your order.
author: sonaz k.

description: Buyer beware!!!!  These people are criminals, their menu says one thing they charge something entirely different.  Combination chow mien $7.95 invoice price $12.20  $4+ more. Broccoli chicken 8.95, price charged to me $11.50. They have done this before and I gave them the benefit of doubt.  Last year their delivery guy gave himself a tip without my consent. The food is ok but unfortunately they are thieves!
author: Sheila N.

description: Found a hair in my food, restaurant did not want to refund me unless I brought back uneaten portion. Rediculous
author: Sarah K.

description: I always order for delivery at work with my co workers. Love their hot and spicy soup, chicken&corn soup, and dim sum is good too. So far i will be a returning costumer for sure!
author: Nart T.

description: Awesome food that unfortunately lives in the shadow of san tung...totally undeservingly. They are super nice.food is great.portions are huge. We tried delivery and they took 26 min from order to our door in outer sunset. Awesome :)
author: Stefan T.

description: Finally, I love a restaurant in my neighborhood! The host is super friendly and greets you with a plate of won ton chips. Imagine: feeling welcome in a Chinese restaurant. The chow fun is really good! Excellent and generous portion of spinach with tofu.  We will be going back and soon will be regulars. It's nice sitting down at a nice table with friendly service and watching the madness across the street at San Tung.
author: Roxanne M.

description: the most rude employees never will i ever order from them again. called to tell them they forgot part of my order and they didn't care. disappointment
author: Caroline D.

description: Exquisite Chinese cuisine. We ordered the Canton Dinner for 2. It consisted of BBQ pork fried rice, broccoli beef, orange chicken and egg rolls + chive and shrimp dumpling. Everything was absolutely amazing and full of flavor. I would recommend it if you're hungry because their servings are generous. Furthermore their ambiance was peaceful and calm compared to other restaurants during dinner.
author: Javier P.

description: One night I was craving for chicken wings but did not want to go to San Tung's since it was worst terrible, experience with San Tung's service and food a few month ago. I decided to give restaurant across the street a try since I was already in the neighborhood.  Wonderful surprise, awesome chicken wings, better than San Tung's. Their noodles were delicious and so was the dumplings. Best service and no San Tung attitude!
author: Mit T.

description: Great food and generous portions at reasonable prices. Try the dry fire chicken wing,garlic eggplant, walnut prawns! Delicious!
author: Mia Z.

description: Such tasty food and good service. The food is very flavorful and spicy dishes are both spicy AND savory. They don't let salt or chilies dominate the whole dish. We will be back!
author: Athena A.

description: Delivery took 1 hr and 22 minutes. Every single dish that we ordered was disgusting and extremely greasy. One of the rare times I want to throw everything out. I would rather eat cereal.
author: Wendy L.

description: Orange Chicken was soggy, yet too spicy for my daughter. Only occasional orange flavor observed. The Kung Pao Chicken had no flavor ! When I ordered from this restaurant, I didn't realize that it was that empty restaurant across the street from San Tung.
author: Steven A.

description: I love their food! The owner recommended me some of their famous dishes. I ordered the wings, fishball with veggies and other food. I would come back again to eat.
author: Kevin D.

description: I give this place 3 and 1/2 stars.  The food was fresh, and portions impressive.  We ordered for delivery and didn't have to wait very long.  My pal had the beef broccoli, and I had the chicken with mushrooms  I tried it once, but I will try it again to make sure I feel the same way.  At least the first impression was a good one!
author: Lawree S.

description: Great 'American' Chinese food. Best General Tso's chicken I've ever had, seriously. Tasty (not too greasy) Chow Mein. Crispy spring rolls. And the Shanghai dumplings (soup dumplings) are amazing! Service was quick and the owner (maybe the manager?) was really funny and sweet. We finally found our go-to Chinese restaurant!
author: Brian G.

description: Been ordering delivery from here for a few weeks now so can't comment on eating there but the delivery is always fast and hot. The food is the best Chinese delivery I've had in the sunset. We have tried a bunch of different stuff on the menu and so far it has all been good.
author: Anthony M.

description: Really loved the food and our waiter was awesome. I wish that our water had been refilled more but the food was great. Try the egg drop soup-- it's filled with veggies!
author: Abbie H.

description:
The food's fairly nice. The service is disappointing.  They messed up and forgot to bring an item.  I thought I'd be a nice person and not insist that they drive across town and bring the food that night.  Big mistake.  The woman I spoke to said next time I ordered they'd give me a "free" replacement.  Well, when I called to get my "free" replacement, the person handling the order insisted I had to order 25.00 worth of food, which is more than I wanted and not fair.  They made the mistake.  Not a nice way to treat a customer.  I cancelled my order and hope GrubHub will get my 8.00 back for me.

GrubHub fixed things.  Meh to Chang's.
author: Monte C.

description: lou is great.  he always makes me feel special and is accomodating to special requests...they have the fastest delivery ever, and food is always hot and fresh, the prices are very fair, some of my favs are the honey walnut shrimp, the chicken and veggies are delish, the wonton soup, and the prawns with scrambled eggs.....great food for a hungover cure or just a lazy day
author: Lizz M.

description: Is a very nice and neat traditional Chinese place. Service are great and friendly. The place is clean and neat. What I order taste good as well. I recommend to come back.
author: KBs C.

description:
Found my new go-to chinese place. Kung pao chicken and the basil-chili chicken were both great. 
Cheap, not too greasy, quick-ish delivery!
author: Ankush K.

description: This place is great! So worth it. Dumplings are awesome! General Tso chicken is the ish!!! Wow! We will be back!!!
author: Scott M.

description: Originally I was going to eat at San tung but it was crowded and was to busy to give me service quickly. I went across to Changs and ordered fried rice and noodles. It was super fast and pretty tasty. This place is close to me so I'll be going there more when I'm craving for Chinese food.
author: Jesse S.

description: Fast delivery, and good Chinese food.
author: Saam D.

description: A truly lackluster experience. The vegetable pot stickers were oily and flavorless. The meatless Mongolian Chicken was incredibly average as well. Nothing was bad, per say, but nothing was indeed truly delicious in any sense. Probably will not be ordering from here again.
author: Anon E.

description: While I can't speak to eating at the restaurant I can tell you the delivery is amazing.  We always order the walnut prawns and the chicken with Chinese greens (gai lan).  With a lot of Chinese delivery the quality varies but with Chang's the food is always good and the delivery people are nice.  The food is reasonably priced and with quick delivery how can you go wrong?
author: Thor B.

description:
Really good!! Part of yet another group that stumbled in here after seeing the dishearteningly long waitlist at San Tung - but I'm glad we ended up here! 

We had a group of 7, seated immediately. They leave a pot of tea at the table, which was nice. 

We ordered: Mongolian beef chow mein, honey walnut prawns, eggplant in garlic sauce, salt and pepper wings, deep fried chicken wings, fried rice

We were really satisfied with pretty much everything we ordered, my favorites being the Mongolian beef chow mein and the fried rice. Word of warning that the Mongolian beef chow mein was really spicy (but so tasty). One tip if you want wings - pick the salt and pepper wings (I think this is what it's called?) over the deep fried - deep fried is slightly bland, while the other one is flavorful. 

Good service, good prices; we ordered 6 appetizers/entrees for 7 people, which came out to about $8.50 a person (including tax and tip!) - and everyone was very full by the end too!
author: Jane D.

description: Super tasty chicken, order delivered extremely quickly and chicken was still nice, warm and surprisingly still crispy. First time customer, definitely eating here again soon!
author: Emerson 3.

description: Ordered delivery, about $75 worth.  Came within a reasonable amount of time.  What I ate was ok, nothing special.  I"d orderd fried rice and something else to take to work to eat the next day, those went into the frig as soon as we got the food.  Work as a mad house and I only got to eat a few  bites before my body said "um, we don't want to eat this anymore" so I tossed it out...and within an hour or so began to have serious stomach problems and had to go home early, had to take a cab because I didn't think I'd make it via bus.  Got home and exploded.  Food poisoning.  3 days of serious explosive purging from both ends.  Then I got feverish and delirious for a few days.  Only drank water for about 5 days and now have to see my doctor because may have damaged my kidneys and some other things because of it.  Even though this may have been one of those rare time where one piece of food may have been bad, I'm never eating Chang's again.
author: Kai T.

description: Last week we ordered delivery from Chang's for the first time. Wow! Finally a great meal from a Chinese restaurant that delivers. We chose the dry fried chicken wings entree (we requested "mild") General Tso's chicken (also mild) and the Phoenix Dragon eggplant. Since our order was over $25, we asked for the complimentary egg fried rice. Everything was fresh and delicious and arrived steaming hot. Given that we live quite a distance from the restaurant (Clayton Street near Corbett Ave.) we were felt we were taking a risk on delivery. Our risk paid off and we were really, really pleased. Chang's is our new "go to" restaurant for tasty Chinese food with excellent delivery service Yum!!!
author: Donald K.

description: Very good food here. I highly recommend this place to people looking for yummy chinese food. The owner and staff are very nice people. Will definitely come back again.
author: David K.

description: Love the steamed pork buns and Singapore style noodles. Have only had delivery and last night they brought us Shanghai style noodles instead of the Singapore noodles we ordered. I called and fresh Singapore noodles were delivered within 30 minutes. Will definitely order from here again!
author: Kristyn C.

description:
Gotten delivery from this place several times.  The drivers are friendly and they follow instructions.  Gold star!

BUT... yes, there's always a but.  The food isn't all that great. In fact, one word describes it all... disappointing.  The "spicy" dishes aren't even spicy.  They give off the appearance they could be but in reality they aren't.  Dim sum is hit or miss... dishes are hit or miss. Would say that everything is hit or miss.  They either got it or they don't and they don't.  It's almost like they change cooks every time.  

The one thing that has been 95% consistent has been their hot & sour soup.  Other than that, you're taking your chances.
author: D G.

description: Chicken wings were good but a little too big. In comparison with the San tung wings across the street, they have different flavors but very similar. They were both good. Lines were shorter. What grossed us out was that while we were eating, they were rolling out huge trash cans through the front ruby next to us. I was a little thrown off but I didn't let it bother me... the first time. The man did this three times. Isn't that a health code violation or something to bring huge garbage cans through the dining area? I'm not sure who the owners are, I'm sure they're nice gard working people but the trash needs to be taken out the back or if that's not possible, wait until your customers are all gone before pulling it through the dining area so as to not ruin the dining experience. Also, as we were finishing up around closing time, the server comes up to us and says "we closed. Ok? Ok." I understand you want to go home and I respect your hours but you should let your customers finish their food. That was really rude. She was also a little forgetful and flustered throughout the whole meal. Maybe she's never served before but I don't see San tung kicking out their customers. In fact, despite their long line, San tung took in everyone, even after they were closed.
author: Brittany N.

description: I ordered a lot of food for delivery. Very prompt and courteous service. Loved the spicy eggplant, Mongolian beef and the spicy basil shrimp. The baby Bok Choy with garlic was crunchy and good. All I all very pleased!
author: Toni J.

description: Ordered delivery the other night because my go to place on 9th Ave closed up shop after 25 years. Truth be told, I'm an idiot for not having tried Chang's before. Wow, SO good. Definitely my new go to for Chinese food in the neighborhood. The extra spicy curry chicken was so good my mom (who hates foreign food) had seconds. Excellent place, and really nice guy who manned the phones and fixed my Eat24 mistake with speed and grace. (and to be clear, I'm no foodie and I doubt I've ever had "authentic" Chinese food more than once (and I wasn't fond of most of what my Hong Kong born and raised eating companion ordered that day))
author: Sergio S.

description:
Ordered :
Lunch General Tso's Chicken - 5/5 . Loved this, will definitely order this again.
Lunch Cashew Nut Chicken - 5/5. Loved this also
 Mu Shu Chicken - 5/5 . Really good, but a little oily.
Chicken Chow Mein - 0/5. The worst chow mein I have ever had, had to throw this away.

Will Order again : 4/5. Yes
author: Rachit A.

description: The older looking waiter is fantastic and he got jokes. 10/10 would come again just for the waiter
author: Ken L.

description: Was walking around this neighborhood, it looked pretty good. We were pleasantly surprised. Good food & yes friendly staff! Above average for cleanliness for a Chinese restaurant.
author: Bea Y.

description: We are traveling from San Diego & this restaurant is amazing since you walk in service is excellent ! Their food is amazing !!!!! Definitely will come again in my next trip !
author: JC E.

description: When i first came here last year it was because San Tung's line was too long. The elderly gentleman who served us was very nice, so we came here a second time. Because the first time that we came here they charge rice per person x 2, so we assumed it was the same, but when the check came they had charged us by the bowl. After pointing this out they took this off our check. Today, the elderly gentleman was no longer working there and the elderly woman/owner at the register brought the check with the total amount so I asked her to itemize it. When we ordered from the waitress we clearly asked her if rice was charged per person or by the bowl and confirmed it was per person. After the owner return with the itemized check, not only did she overcharge us for the rice but they charged us per bowl. The menu price was $1.45, but she charged us $1.60. When I pointed this out to the waitress and she brought it back to the owner she got yelled at by the owner. First of all I did not appreciate when members of my own Chinese community try to cheat people because it reflects on the rest of us. Most other customers would not ask for an itemized receipt. Second of all, I don't appreciate owners yelling at their employees so loudly (because a customer pointed out something that they try to do that was unethical) that the whole restaurant could hear. As I pointed out in another review I wish my Chinese cousins would learn that the loss of customers is not worth the extra $0.15 they're making nickel-and-diming every customer that doesn't check their bill. By the way we can hear Chang in the kitchen calling another employee a bitch. No more Chang's Kitchen for me!
author: K T.

description: I love the spicy chicken wings here, I can't believe I come here many times just for the wings.
author: David Z.

description: Definitely fast food quality. Two dishes we order, mixed veggie tofu and garlic filet mignon  uses the same dark sauce and same viggies. And the filet mignon is tough, veggie are not cooked enough, not flavorful regardless the unappetizing dark sauce.  Lots of takeout and delivery business. Service is nice though, friendly server.
author: jane z.

description: I've ordered from this place several times. Their delivery is always timely (30-40 minutes if you're in the Sunset like me) and the food is always good. My main staples are the Walnut Prawns, Sweet and Sour Pork, and Shrimp Fried Rice (comes out to about $30 with tip, but will last you 3-4 meals). The breading always has the perfect amount of crunch, nothing is every soggy, and they don't skimp on the shrimp. I got some General's Chicken in my last order where a few of the pieces were more breading than chicken, but it still tasted great. This is definitely decadent food, and you will definitely enjoy it!
author: Robert G.

description: Best service of any restaurant I've ever been at, hands down. The hot and sour soup, sweet and sour chicken and chili dumplings (forgot the name) were all very very good, but the Honey walnut prawns were alright.
author: Ben Y.

description: I really like this restaurant and will definitely come back more often! I went there with a very good friend and we received warm greetings from the owner of the restaurant. The service was awesome and the food was amazing. Our favorite includes the honey walnut prawns, the chicken wings, and the beef chow fun (with egg gravy/sauce). I also like the ribs with barbecue sauce  we had but it was a bit hard to bite through. I'll definitely come back to try more dishes here!
author: Cheng W.

description: This place may be overlooked because it is right across the street from San Tungs. And yes, its hard to beat the wings at San Tungs, but most other items on their menu are so-so. Everything we ordered at Changs was delicious! It didn't have that cheap, greasy feel like at many other Chinese restaurants. It tasted fresh and authentic, and the service was excellent. The Singapore noodles were one of my favorite items. Highly recommend this place!
author: Margaret N.

description: Tried them based on a flyer.  Sub-par in every regard.  Going back to Andy's
author: Douglas B.

description: ordered many times from CK (Chang's Kitchen) what use to be pleasure to order from has turned to an annoyance, ordered a vegetarian rice & half of the box was empty, nothing is proportioned equally, my wife said where's the veggies, being a lite eater, it was definitely short on veggies. rice was hard & after a quick reheat in the microwave the rice got harder & stuck together! even with a wet papertowel on it. Reviews from the people who order pork buns, chow mein, dinner for 2, have no business rating CK! CK cannot be compared to san tung! why do you think it's a 90 min wait, case closed! the couple who ordered the dinner for 2, well, guess what, these were assembled for non chinese not insulting anyone, to each their own! I would never order that. for the couple who ordered the har gow & shiu mai, better rethink why it look raw, that stuff is usually made in large quantities & stored in the freezer, the ones you ate were definitely frozen & under cooked. haven for food poisoning! but my main complaint is i ordered for delivery & owner is cheap, i specifically asked for utensils & napkins, i don't care who's responsible for packing these important items, i even called once (not 1st time) & said if i'm not home, how am i supposed to eat it. she gave some lame excuse saying her driver forgot, i just wanted to reiterate the importance of following instructions. So my order was missing these things again, so i contacted delivery.com & the rep was fully understanding my request & was super helpful. as i was chatting with her online the driver returned with utensils & napkins. the thing was what he said, whether it was true or not, he expressed his feelings which was uncalled for. All they did was blame each other & what goes on between them should be between them & not passed on to us the consumer. back to my complaint, driver said his mgr who is the owner biitched to my wife that she loss money on this order. at this point i had enough & spoke to a mgr at delivery.com & he spoke to Jenny the owner, she apologized after their long conversation. she offered to give me one spring roll  to amend the confusion,  i told delivery.com that the 1 spring roll is included on every order. I am not going to accept that offer it's invalid as an offer, besides that is not my idea of a springroll, it's an eggroll that is so cheap to make, yet they charge over a dollar for one, unreal!  CK, YOU HAVE LOST A LOYAL CUSTOMER, CAVEAT EMPTOR! ALL THEY WANT TO DO IS PROFIT FROM YOU. LEARN HOW TO READ & STOP BEING SO CHEAP, MOST IMPORTANLY BE CAREFUL WIH THEIR FOOD!
author: david c.
